loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia, who is a 34-year-old single woman, lives in Tbilisi city. She has only a father, who is involved in a small trading business and generates insignificant income. Up until now, before Maia started her own activity, her father's income was their only source of income. Maia has just started her own business, specifically she opened a beauty salon, where she serves clients herself. 

In order to make her work more effective, Maia asked for financial support from local financial institutions. Maia has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She will purchase all needed tools and continue providing her lovely service. The loan will greatly assist Maia and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To supply her beauty salon with good tools and get many customers

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia has successfully built her garments business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she started her business of cloth trade. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a wide variety of winter cloth in different colors and styles according to the customers' demands. This will enable her to increase her sales and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of winter cloth in different colors and styles according to her customers' demands

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 44-year-old married woman.  She has been doing a business of cattle trade with the help of her husband for many years. The business is good enough to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family. Shahnaz is a mother of six children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has gradually improved the business with the support of Kashf Foundation. It’s her fifth year with it. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats in order to boost her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats in order to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Oumouna's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le jour de son inauguration, le groupe est composé de femmes très dynamiques et engagées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles sont dans leur majorité dans le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie depuis plusieurs années. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et partagent des liens de solidarité très solides. 

Madame Oumouna (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe.  Elle est âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et  mère de 05 enfants dont : 04 garçons et 01 fille. Son activité s’articule autour de la vente de sucre, thé vert, huile de palme, pâte d’arachide, de savon  manufacturé et de fabrication locale. Elle achète ses produits au marché régional pour la revente dans son village par détail. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra  d’acheter 01 sac de sucre, 01 bidon de 20 litres d’huile de palme, du savon, du thé vert et une grosse de savon.

Les bénéfices de son commerce lui permettront d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge ses enfants en ceux qui concernent fournitures, les frais scolaires et santé.
texts.en:
Established the day of the inauguration, this group is made up of women who are very dynamic and engaged in their businesses. They work in small-scale commerce and accompany this with rain-fed agriculture, which they have done for some years. They all live in the same village and share very strong ties of solidarity.

Oumouna (who is seated on the far right with her hand raised [in the photo]) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 37 years old, married, and a mother of four children, of whom four are boys and one is a girl. She works selling sugar, green tea, palm oil, groundnut paste, and manufactured and locally made soap. She buys these products from a regional market and resells them in her village at retail. She has a good experience with this work.

This new loan will serve to buy one sac of sugar, one 20-liter drum of palm oil, green tea, and soap. Earnings from this business will allow her to support her husband to take care of their children's diet, school fees, and health.

loans.use: to buy one sac of sugar, one 20-liter drum of palm oil, green tea, and soap

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
Madame Oumy est membre du banc villageois depuis sa création, c’est une femme très engagée dans la gestion du groupement. Elle est mariée, âgée de 52 ans et mère de 06 enfants dont 5 garçons et une fille. Elle est vendeuse de bananes et divers produits alimentaires. Elle s’approvisionne dans village de planteurs de bananes pour la revente par détail au marché central. Elle renouvelle tous les 10 jours au moins sa commande. Elle a une bonne maitrise de cette activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au moins 05 cartons de banane pour la revente.

Ses bénéfices réalisés serviront à aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et d’accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
Oumy has been a member of the banc villageois since its creation. She is very engaged in the group's management.

She is married, 52 years old, and is the mother of six children, of whom five are boys and one is a girl. 

Oumy works selling bananas and various food products. She procures her goods from the villages that grow bananas and resells them at retail at the central market. She restocks at least every ten days, according to demand. She has a good experience with this work.

With this new loan, she plans to buy at least five boxes of bananas to resell. Earnings will serve to help her husband with the daily expenses and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy at least five boxes of bananas to resell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana tiene 47 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar. Ana y su esposo poseen una panadería familiar la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Tiene 5 años de contar con dicha panadería y gracias a sus buenos productos y buenos precios muchas personas la prefieren. Ana desea mejorar sus ventas e ingresos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios para continuar vendiendo el delicioso pan. Con el monto solicitado comprará: harina, azúcar, leche, mermeladas, huevos, aceite, etc. Espera poder lograr su objetivo y de esta forma dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old, and lives with her family. Ana and her husband own a family bakery, which is their main source of income. She has had the bakery for 5 years, and thanks to their good products and good prices, many people prefer them. 
Ana wants to improve her sales and income, which is why she asks for this loan to FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials to keep selling the delicious bread. With the asked amount, she will buy: flour, sugar, milk, jams, eggs, oil, etc. She hopes to achieve her goal and in this way give her family better life conditions.

loans.use: To buy: flour, sugar, milk, jams, eggs, oil, etc. for the production and sale of bread.

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL LAS PALOMAS ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIES INTEGRANTES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE VEINTE HIJOS SON ORIGINARIOS DE SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN. SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.  EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN POR SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE Y  , EMOCIONAL QUE NECESITAN SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES TOMASA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS LÁCTEOS COMO LECHE, CUAJADA, QUESO, CREMA, LECHE AGRIA. DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIES  DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y  COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTO LÁCTEOS PARA PODER SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. LAS PALOMAS AGRADECEN LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Las Palomas village bank is made up of ten members, mothers and fathers responsible for twenty children. They are native to Sauce, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. They are characterized as hardworking, responsible, eager for self improvement. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, they couldn't study and they saw the necessity to work at an early age in order to help with the expenses of the home.

Currently, they fight for getting their family ahead and the emotional needs of their children. Thanks to her eagerness to get ahead, the coordinator is Tomasa. As an economic activity, she sells dairy products like: milk, cheese, fresh cheese, sour cream on foot and in her house. She works some ten hours daily, offering her products so that in the not-so-distant future she can obtain better income.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to buy more dairy products to be able to satisfy the demand of her customers. Las Palomas are thankful for the help that the Kiva investors bring to the people of scant resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to buy dairy products like: milk, cheese, fresh cheese, sour cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stuffed animals and toys.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown children. She lives in Isabel, Leyte. Judith owns and runs a small sari-sari or variety store, selling various goods and food items to the people in her area. For more than four years now, Judith has earned her income through this business. Now, Judith wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits. This loan will enable Judith to improve her inventory and attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Judith hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Suong's Group

texts.en:
Suong is 37 years old and lives with her son and daughter. Her husband is a driver for hire. For the past six years, Suong has been running a store selling rice from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family.

She is the Group Leader of a three-member loan group who live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is on the left wearing a blue jacket. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Suong is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of rice to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy rice to restock her store.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last few years.

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Therefore, Balqees has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Balqees is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is 48 years old and married with three children. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past 20 years, Hoang has sold fish from a stall. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more kinds of fish to meet his customers' needs. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business.

loans.use: to buy fish for selling from his stall.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 45, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two daughters and her husband. Loan and her husband earn money through their business, selling food for breakfast for people in their community. She started this business three years ago. 

Loan would  like to get a loan to enlarge her inventory of raw food and rice to make food to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy raw food and rice to make meals for selling from her stall.

loans.name: Benvinido

texts.en:
Benvinido runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic household merchandise like eggs, salt, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, soap, and seasonings. He is a 37-year-old married man. He has a twelve year old son. He lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

To augment his income, he raises and sells hogs. He has been engaged in this business for three years.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock for the store and to purchase pig feed. This stock will help attract more buyers to his store.  He will also start to raise and sell more healthy hogs. 

In the future, Benvinido hopes that he can handle both sources of income properly to be successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his store and to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita, a 52-year-old married mother of seven, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Having borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF, Pacita has requested a new one for PHP 10000 to purchase more items to sell in her store. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Metije

texts.en:
Metije is 29 years old and has two children, ages 2 and 4. She is a housewife and works hard to care for her children, family, and home. Metije's husband is the main source of income and works long days in a restaurant kitchen. Her husband prepares food and has to work long hours and very hard just to make enough money to provide food for his family. Because he has a low income, the family is under financial stress.

In order to provide for her family, Metije is involved in agriculture. She keeps cows and the family consumes the milk and dairy products. This helps the family save on expenses and also provides the family with adequate nutrition. The cow stable is very old and Metije is requesting a loan to renovate the stable, purchase a calf, and install a water system inside the stable. Since she cannot pay for these items on her own, she immediately applied for a loan when she heard about KosInvest. The loan will help Metije to continue to provide for her family. Eventually, she would like to increase the size of her farm.

loans.use: to renovate the stable, purchase a calf, and to install a water system in the stable.

loans.name: Martha Francisca

texts.es:
Martha es una persona humilde es madre soltera de tres niños vive en San Miguel Povincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Santo Cristo, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas y semilla de maiz para sembrar para asi mejorar la produccion, las compras realiza en San Miguel cada semana, Su sueño es mejorar el ingreso economico para sus hijos ya que les mantiene sola. En su tiempo libre le gusta tejer y jugar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is a humble individual and a single mother with three children. She lives in the community of Santo Cristo in San Miguel, which is located in Bolivar Province. Martha is a member of the San Francisco Communal Bank.

She is a farmer and also raises animals. Martha is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies and corn seeds for planting so that she can improve her production. Her purchases are conducted in San Miguel each week. Martha’s dream is to improve her income for her children since she is the only one supporting them.

In her free time, she enjoys knitting and playing with her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and corn seeds for planting.

loans.name: Carlos Gilbel

texts.es:
Carlos, de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta 1º año de bachillerato, no pudo terminar sus estudios, por que su padre no tenía las facilidades económicas para poder seguir pagando sus estudios.- Actualmente, trabaja como agricultor y también realiza sus propios cultivos, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos están estudiando, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Carlos, es una persona muy trabajadora, se levanta todos los días a las cinco de la mañana a trabajar en la agricultura, alquila terrenos para sembrar maíz.- Este año, ha sembrado una hectárea de terreno y también tiene cultivos de ajonjolí y frijol, ésta actividad la aprendió de su padre, quien también es agricultor.- La distancia que tiene que caminar para ir hasta donde están sus cultivos, está a dos kilómetros de distancia.

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar lámina y ladrillo, para terminar de  construir su vivienda.

El sueño de Carlos, es tener una vivienda digna en donde pueda vivir de forma segura, con sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Carlos, 33 years old, studied until the first year of high school. He couldn't finish his studies because his father didn't have the economic facilities to be able to continue paying for his studies. Currently, he works as a farmer and also does his own crops. He is partnered and has three children, two of whom are studying. His partner dedicates herself to domestic work.

Carlos is a very hardworking person. He gets up every day at five in the morning to work in agriculture. He rents land to plant corn. This year, he's planted one hectare of land and he also has crops of sesame and beans. He learned this activity from his father, who also is a farmer. The distance that he has to walk to go to where his crops are is two kilometers of distance.

Carlos needs the loan to buy roofing and bricks to finish constructing his home. Carlos' dream is to have a dignified home where he can live in a secure manner with his children and his wife.

loans.use: to buy roofing and bricks to finish constructing his home.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 41 years old and both of her children are in school.

Mary Jane has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for six years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 57 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, comenta que se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de ladrillos comunes, cuenta con personas que lo ayudan en su trabajo, ya que crea fuentes de trabajo para otros.
El Sr. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar arcilla en cantidad, ya que es su materia prima para hacer ladrillos y quiere poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is 57. He is single, lives in the city of Caacupé and comments that he works in the making and sale of common bricks. He has people who help him in his work, since he makes a source of work for others.

Juan is a very hardworking and tenacious person who wants to continue with his work as he's doing. It's for this that he is applying for this loan, to be able to buy clay in quantity, given that this is his prime material for making bricks and he wants to be able to fulfill the orders of his customers.

loans.use: to buy clay to make bricks.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba was born in 1964. She lives with her family in Tajikistan. Mahbuba has a son and a daughter. 

For the past three years, Mahbuba has run an animal husbandry business. She feeds cattle and sells their meat and milk at a local market. Mahbuba develops her business by offering high quality products to her customers. She supplements her income by growing crops and cattle feed. Currently, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle. Mahbuba awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Flor Lissette

texts.es:
Flor de 35 años de edad estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica, no pudo seguir con sus estudios debido a la difícil situación económica por la que pasaba su familia. Es casada y tiene 3 hijos de entre 4 y 10 años de edad. 

Toda la familia trabaja junta, se levantan a las 5:30 am de la mañana para trabajar en las actividades diarias que se centran en la agricultura y la crianza de pollo de engorde. Por las mañanas trabajan en las parcelas que alquilan y en la tarde se dedican a la granja.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar arena, cemento, ladrillo, hierro y demás para construir una galera y tener sus animales porque donde están actualmente es inadecuado. Flor espera que con los ingresos que obtenga de los proyectos a realizar iniciar una tienda de productos básicos ya que sería la única en la zona.
texts.en:
Flor, who is 35 years old, studied until the 6th grade of primary education. She could not continue with her studies due to the difficult economic situation her family was going through. She is married, and has 3 children, who are between 4 and 10 years of age.
The whole family works together, they get up at 5:30 in the morning to do the daily activities that are based in agriculture and breeding chickens for fattening. In the mornings, they work in the plots of land that they rent, and in the afternoon they work on the farm.
She asks for a loan to buy sand, cement, brick, iron and more to build a place to keep her animals, because their current area is inadequate. 
Flor hope that with the income she gets from the projects, she can start a store for basic products, as it would be the only one in the area.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, brick, iron, and more.

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es: Angélica es una joven de 21 años de edad, residente en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de soledad, está dedicada a la venta de artículos para el cuidado personal, ropa, fragancias y calzado, ella decidió ocupar su tiempo y tener ingresos desde su casa, en la comodidad de su hogar junto a su niña de dos años de edad, ella inició a partir de este año 2014 y ha logrado consolidar a sus clientes, a quienes les ofrece comodidad de pago, poco a poco ha fortaleciendo su capital de trabajo y se apoya en las redes sociales y catálogos especializados en ventas de productos, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en la compra de ropa, fragancias y calzado. Ella considera que esta inversión generará mayor incremento de ventas y de clientes.  Ella es madre de un niña a la que desea ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia, así mismo ser el apoyo de su cónyuge para poder cumplir con sus metas a futuro.
texts.en:
Angélica is a young woman of 21 years of age. She is a resident of a neighborhood located in the municipality of Soledad. She works selling personal care items, clothing, fragrances and shoes. She decided to occupy her time and have income from her house, in the comfort of her home along with her daughter of two years of age. She started this year, 2014, and has achieved consolidating her clients, to whom she offers the convenience of payment. Little by little, she has strengthened her working capital and she relies on social media and specialized catalogs in product sales. Her main customers are her neighbors, family and friends.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she's done from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, by which she will invest in the purchase of clothing, fragrances and shoes. She considers that this investment will generate a larger increase of sales and of customers. She is the mother of a daughter to whom she wishes to offer a better quality of life along with her family as well as being the support of her spouse in order to be able to fulfill her future goals.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fragrance and shoes.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell to her customers for her buy and sell dry goods business.

Jenny has been in this business for one year. Jenny earns more income from raising livestock.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Justiniana works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Justiniana is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Justiniana has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar has successfully built her cloth selling business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more variety of winter cloth in different colors and styles. This will enable her to increase her sales by attracting more customers and to gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of winter cloth in different colors and styles.

loans.name: La Lomita Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Lomita se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de comités, este grupo tiene las expectativas de ir mejorando y creciendo en cada una de las actividades que ellas vienen haciendo. Es un grupo que quiere crecer y salir adelante.
Cada una de ellas pone su mejor esfuerzo, pero se destaca la Sra. Cynthia  quien es costurera, y poco a poco se fue abriendo camino y hoy ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre le lleva pedidos y trabajos. Comenta que su meta es poder ir creciendo y de ser posible que pueda dar trabajo a otras personas.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas para poder usarlo en confecciones varias. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The La Lomita group is found in its first cycle of the village bank program. This group has expectations of going improving and growing in every one of the activities that they are doing. It's a group that wants to grow and get ahead.

Each one of them puts forth her best effort but Cynthia, who is a seamstress, stands out. Little by little, she went opening a path and today she already has a very good clientele that always brings her orders and work. She comments that her goal is to be able to go growing and be possible so that she can give work to other people.

She is applying for this loan for the purchase of fabric to be able to use it in various sewing projects. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector proviene de una familia humilde con ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Su meta es culminar sus estudios y ser alguien en la vida. Está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería química, con lo cual quiere poder ser un profesional exitoso.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Hector comes from a modest family that is trying to move forward and make progress. His goal is to finish his studies and make something out of his life. He is studying for a degree in Chemical Engineering because he wants to become a successful professional.

Hector is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his university fees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
Olimjon is 30 years old. He lives in a small village with his wife, two children and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension.

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. He has been busy with feeding cattle for more than five years. He buys cattle, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market. He manages the business alone. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family.

He wants to develop his business, but he does not have money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle, and from the profit, improve his living condition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing the number of his cattle.

loans.name: Tiguida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 15/06/08.IL est composé de femme issues de la même localité.Elles sont liées par la caution solidaire.Leur activité principale est le commerce

Niatou se trouvant à droite de la photo,et levant le bras est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont02 garçons.
Niatou s'active dans le domaine du commerce.Elle vend de la patte d'arachide, du mais, du piment et du piments.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs année.Elle a de l’expérience dans ce domaine.Elle mène ses activités au sein de sa localité.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 20 sacs d'arachides à 10000f le sac,14 sacs de maïs à 7500f le sac,10 seaux de patte d'arachide à 15000f l'un et 15 kg de piment à 3000f le kg.
Le bénéfice réalise lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
This group was created 15 June 2008. It is made up of women from the same area. They share joint collateral and work mainly in commerce.

Niatou, who is found on the right of the photo with her hand raised [in the photo], is the featured borrower of the group. She is 42 years old, married, and a mother of six children, of whom two are boys.

Niatou works in commerce, where she sells groundnut paste, corn, and peppers. She has been doing this work for several years and has experience. She conducts her business in her area.

With this loan, she plans to buy 20 sacs of groundnuts at 10,000 francs per sac, 14 sacs of corn at 7,500 per sac, 10 buckets of groundnut paste at 15,000 francs each, and 15 kilograms of peppers at 3,000 francs per kilogram.

Earnings will allow her to strengthen her business and to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy groundnut paste, peppers, corn, and groundnuts

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Isabel, Leyte. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than twenty years now. Fishing is a very lucrative business in their place.

Liza is standing next to fishing nets with her youngest son. As of now, she would like to avail herself of a loan to buy fishing gear such as nets, lead weights, hooks, and a bucket for storage. This loan will be a great help for them in improving their fishing business.

In the future, Liza hopes to make their fishing business a success and stable. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear such as nets, lead weights, hooks, and a bucket for storage.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene engages in raising and selling hogs. She is a married woman with six children from Mcarthur, Leyte. Of her six children, only one child is still attending school. She has been in the hog raising business for almost ten years now.

Arlene has requested a loan to buy pig feed and to purchase materials for pig pen repairs. This will help Arlene and her family start to raise and sell healthy  pigs. She will be able to provide a better pen for the pigs.  With this, she will start to gain higher income.

In the future, she is hoping that she will have enough resources and the ability to manage her business well.  This will lead to a better livelihood and the ability to continue financing the schooling of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and purchase materials for pig pen repairs.

loans.name: Belty Zuleima

texts.es: Belty de 31 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo pupusas, tortas, bebidas frías, golosinas, etc. actividad que realiza en un pequeño local junto a un mercado municipal, por lo que la afluencia de personas es muy buena al igual que sus ventas. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando con el apoyo de ella. Belty desea vender comidas en su negocio ya que en esta época navideña el mercado se llena y las ventas de comida son muy buenas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: carne, pollo, pescado, verduras, legumbres, arroz, etc. Para vender comida a las personas que visitan el mercado.
texts.en:
Belty is 31 years old and an enterprising woman who earns her living by selling “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas), sandwiches, cold drinks, snack foods, and other items. She conducts her business from a small shop located at the municipal market. The flow of customers there is very good, as well as her sales.

Belty resides in her own home along with her three children, who are currently studying with her support. She wants to sell food at her business during the Christmas season since the market is crowded and food sales are good at that time. For this reason, Belty is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, legumes, rice, and other supplies. As a result, she will be able to sell food to the people who visit the market.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, legumes, rice, and other supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a fish vendor. She sells fresh fish to the people in her community. She is a 33-year-old married woman with two children, aged 14 and 10 years old. She lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. 

Alma has requested a loan to buy additional fresh fish to resell. This will help Alma sell more fish and cater to her customers with a wider variety to choose from. In this way, her income will improve and she will be able to provide her family with nutritious diets and better shelter to live in.

She would like to expand her business to be able to continue sending her children to school in hopes of giving them a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Khadidiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le jour de son inauguration, les différents groupes de ce banc villageois sont composés de femmes très dynamiques dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles sont dans leur majorité dans le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie depuis plusieurs années. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et partagent des liens de solidarité très solides. 

Madame Khadidiatou (debout à droite avec  une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe.  Elle est âgée de 41 ans, est mariée et  mère de 05 enfants dont : 02 garçons et 03 filles. Son activité s’articule autour de la vente de produits de consommation courante à savoir : sucre, thé vert fruit selon la saison : banane, orange, …. Pour les fruits elle s’approvisionne auprès de producteurs des villages environnant et pour les produits finis dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra  d’acheter 01 sac de sucre, 20 paquets de thé vert et 02 à 03 cartons de bananes et divers autres produits de consommation courante.

 Les bénéfices de son commerce lui permettront de prendre en charge ses enfants en ceux qui concernent fournitures, les frais scolaires et santé.
texts.en:
Established on its opening day, the various groups of this banc villageois are made up of women who are very energetic in their businesses. The majority of them have been running small businesses, combined with agriculture during the rainy season, for several years. They all live in the same village and share a very strong solidarity.

Mrs. Khadidiatou (standing at right with one hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of five children: two boys and three girls. Her business is based on the sale of consumer goods, including sugar, green tea, and seasonal fruit (bananas, oranges, etc.). For the fruit, she gets her supplies from producers in the surrounding villages and, for the finished goods, from the weekly markets.

This new loan will allow Mrs. Khadidiatou to purchase one sack of sugar, 20 packets of green tea, two to three boxes of bananas, and various other consumer goods. The profits from her business will allow Mrs. Khadidiatou to pay for supplies, school fees, and health care for her children.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of sugar, 20 packets of green tea, two to three boxes of bananas, and various other consumer goods.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of three grown-up children. Ligaya lives with her family in Isabel, Leyte. Ligaya has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than three years now. Her husband earns an additional income as a carpenter.

Ligaya is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With a loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Trinidad Idalinda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuestra Señora De la Luz se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Trinidad, tiene 70 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad una de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Trinidad es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  ella también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes mas conocidos. Trabaja tres días por semana pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas es mas fresco  y se le hace más fácil salir a vender sus prendas, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva 11 años dedicada al comercio con  el cual se gana lo suyo y les sirve mucho ya que en ocasiones su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 10 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Credit Group "Nuestra Señora de la Luz" meets every fortnight in Manta. The city is known for her beautiful beaches, that receive many visitors during the whole year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with numerous tourist attractions.

There lives Trinidad, she is 70 years old and she is married with three children, who are all of legal age and one of which still lives with them. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Trinidad is a very good wife that helps her husband with the house expenses by selling door to door all kinds of clothes. She also sells at home to her regular customers. She works three days a week, but especially in the mornings, because at this time the weather is cooler and it makes it easier for her to go out to sell her clothes. She lets her customers pay on credit and receives the payments every weekend. She has worked in commerce for 11 years. This job allows her to make some money, which really helps, since sometimes there isn't any work for her husband.

She will use this loan to buy more clothing: trousers, tops, t-shirts and children clothes. She has been a member of the credit group for 10 years and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, tops, t-shirts and children clothing

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casado, vive con su esposa e hijo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café.Con el credito anterior no le fue lo suficiente para dar el mantenimiento adecuado Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el tercer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ruben, who is 30 years old, is married and lives with his wife and son; they are his top priority. With his loan, he hopes to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and to pay laborers to help with the coffee. With the previous loan, it was not enough to give him adequate maintenance. With these improvements to the crops he hopes to have a little profit and in that way improve the condition of his family's life. He also hopes to invest a bit more in his farming land and complete some goals. This is the third loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to attend to his coffee plantation in buying fertilizers, fungicide, and paying day laborers.

loans.name: Maxilinda

texts.en:
Maxilinda is 62 years old and married with five children. Maxilinda works very hard to provide for them.

Maxilinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, milk, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Maxilinda has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, milk, noodles, soft drinks, etc. 

Maxilinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, milk, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken lives in Norapat village, Armavir region. He lives there with his family members: parents, sister and brother. 

Babken is now a second year student at Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture. To be able to pay for his university tuition, Babken has applied for this loan. He hopes to receive the lenders’ support.

loans.use: To be able to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien is 49 years old and lives with three sons and her husband. For the past four years, Lien has been running a general store from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a five-member loan group and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is wearing a red blouse. Each of the group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities. 

Lien is requesting a loan to purchase better-quality and a greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is 57 years old and is married. He has two children and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker in a local company. He supports his family by making metal tools and equipment.

He intends to use his loan to repair his house and buy materials for his current business.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy materials for his metal shop and to repair his house.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu would like to take a further loan to buy more beverages for selling and to repair her house.

Hieu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family.

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell and to repair her house.

loans.name: Al-Khir Group

texts.en:
Al-Khir is the same group which previously applied for a loan from Kiva Lenders.This group consists of Zynab, Asma, Fatima and Khiria. This group haven't yet completely repaid the first loan but has applied for a concurrent loan of 110,000 YER from Kiva Lenders.

Fatima is the leader of the group, a married woman and a mother of three children. Selling phones in the streets is her sole source of income.

Before she applied for the first loan from Kiva lenders with the other members of the group, Fatima was selling clothes. The first loan helped Fatima to improve her business to start selling phones. She thanks Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan. In reality, Fatima didn't yet completely return the repayment of all the instalments of the first loan. In order to purchase phones to resell them in the streets in the hope of increasing her income, Fatima applied for a concurrent loan of 30,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

She hopes this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to purchase phones to resell them in the streets to increase her income.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
This client lives in Jermuk with her husband, parents-in-law, brother-in-law, and little daughter. Narine is engaged in agriculture. Specifically, she is involved in beekeeping. From the 15 beehives that she owns, Narine gets honey and sells it locally.  

She wants to increase the number of beehives. With the requested loan, Narine plans to purchase 15 more beehives. With the loan’s help, Narine will increase her income and ensure better living conditions for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 15 more beehives

loans.name: Edme

texts.en:
Edme is a dedicated babysitter at a pre school at El Alto. She is also an enthusiastic clothes saleswoman specializing in children's clothes. She is helped by her 25-year-old son. Edme is 58 years old.

Edme needs a loan to buy more clothes for the season. The sport clothes are in high demand, so she and her son have a chance to increase their income. Edme appreciates a lot that you publish her information on the Kiva website.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for the season

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush, her husband, and son live in Ashotavan village. Siranush has been engaged in horticulture and livestock breeding for ten years. She took a loan last year and was able to purchase cattle. Now, with this requested loan, Siranush would like to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This loan is very important for Siranush and she hopes for lenders’ support.

loans.use: to purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Santana, de 40 años de edad, no estudio, desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre, luego se acompaño y junto a su pareja tienen dos hijas, de los cuales una está acompañada y la otra hija vive con el, ya que su esposa, debido a una enfermedad falleció y su hija es quien le ayuda, para que el pueda realizar sus trabajos en el campo y poder obtener los ingresos para comprar lo básico en la casa. 

Santana, ya tiene 15 años de trabajar como agricultor.- El necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes ya que tiene sembrado 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y necesita fertilizarlos para que su cultivo pueda crecer y de buen rendimiento al momento de su cosecha. 

Santana, quiere darle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija, es por eso que trabaja muy duro día a día.
texts.en: Santana is 40 years old, did not attend school, and began to work farming alongside his father when he was a little boy. Later when he married he had two children with his wife, one is now married and the other lives with him. His wife died from an illness and it is his daughter who helps his so that he can do his farm work and be able to obtain income to buy basic items for the household.  Santana has been working as a farmer for 15 years. He needs a loan to buy fertilizers as he has planted 7000 square meters of corn and needs to fertilize the crops so that his crops can grow and be productive at the moment of harvest. Santana wants to provide the best living conditions for his daughter, so he works hard day after day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Berta Lidia

texts.es: Berta,  tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, reside en una aldea del Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Berta, lleva 3 años aproximadamente de tener su propia fuente de ingresos para la manutención de la familia. Vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como son camisetas, short, blusas, pantalones, ropa de niño y también sandalias, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en la aldea y sus alrededores. Ha decidido solicitar otro prestamo a la institución para comprar más ropa y vender en esta temporada de fin de año. Quiere surtir con camisas, blusas y ropa de niño. Ella piensa que con las ganancias va poder darles educación a sus hijos. Su sueño es mantener siempre su negocio para obtener ingresos propios.
texts.en:
Berta is 38 years old, a single mother, and has three children under her care. She lives in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. For approximately three years Berta has had her own source of income to support her family. She sells clothing for women, men, and children like shirts, shorts, blouses, pants, and kid's clothes as well as sandals. She carries out her business as a street vendor in her village and its surroundings.

She has decided to request another loan from the institution to buy more clothing to sell in this end of year season. She wants to stock shirts, blouses, and children's clothing. She believes that with the profits she will be able to give her children an education. Her dream is to keep her business going always to make her own income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell in this end of year season. She wants stock shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Serafin

texts.en: Serafin is 48 years old and he pays rent. He actually lives with his eldest son. Serafin is a taxi driver. Recently he was in the hospital for a surgery but the doctors told him that he had to rest a very long time so he is not driving right now. He rented a little place where he and his son are living. Serafin wants to put up n little grocery store but right now he needs to pay the maintenance of his car because it is the only thing that allows him to make some money. Serafin remembers what the doctor said, but he needs to work and he promises he will leave the taxi driving as soon as he can.

loans.use: to pay the maintenance of his car

loans.name: Mwambisi Group

texts.en:
Rashida, who is in her early 30s, is single with three children who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for six years now. She works from 5am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rashida's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, flour, etc. and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, started building her house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to open another place for the same business of selling food. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Rashida will share this loan with her loan group "Mwambisi" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another place for the same business of selling food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of bags and accessories for his stall

loans.name: Virginia Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Virginia tiene la edad de 54 años, estudio la primaria, desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la Actividad del Comercio, tiene su propio negocio de Pulpería que le permite sacar adelante su familia y brindar educación a  hija que regreso a vivir con ella por haberle ido mal en su matrimonio.  Doña Virginia desde su domicilio ofrece a sus clientes variedad de productos, Carnes, Gaseosas, Jugos, Granos Básicos, Galletas, Pasta dental, Jabones, y otros productos de pulpería, sus ganancias son invertidas un 50% en el mismo negocio, y el otro 50% en sus gastos básicos  y compromisos de pagos, se destaca por ser una persona honrada y muy responsable.

En fechas pasada atravesó una situación se le enfermo su hermana y a ella le toco asumir sus medicamentos provocando un menor rendimiento económico en su negocio.  Su crédito con kiva le ha servido para incrementar su capital y tener mayor variedad de productos ahora ofrece también ropa interior de niños y adultos y se mantiene en el mercado del comercio. Nuevamente se remite a Afodenic para solicitar fondos con Kiva y continuar mejorando su economía familiar con esto de la situación económica el crédito es un medio de salir adelante para las personas de recursos económicos medios como ella y agradece por haber personas que brindan este servicio y que tienen un gran corazón.

Su propósito siguiente si Dios le concede es hacer un préstamo mayor cuando cancele este para invertirlo en ampliar el local y dar mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old, studied through primary school and has worked in business since she was very young. She now has her own convenience store that lets her support her family and provide education to her daughter, who returned to live with her after things went badly in her marriage.

Virginia offers her clients various products from her home, including meats, sodas, juices, basic grains, cookies, tooth pastes, soaps and other general products. Her income is invested 50% back into the business and the other 50% in basic expenses and payments agreements. She stands out for being an honorable and a very responsible person.

In the past she struggled through a tough situation. Her sister got sick and she had to take responsibility for her medications, hurting the economic output of her business. She has used her loan with Kiva to increase her capital and have a greater variety of products. Now she also offers children's and adults' underwear and she has stayed in the business market.

She has been in contact with Afodenic again to ask for funds from Kiva to continue improving her family's economy. Loans are a way for people with medium economic resources like her to get ahead, and she is grateful that there are people to provide this service and that have such large hearts.

Her next objective, if God allows, is to get a larger loan when this one is through to invest in expanding her store and paying more attention to her clients.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of basic grains, juices, sodas and other products that she has included in her business to improve her quality of life and her income.

loans.name: Norbey Alberto

texts.es:
Norbey es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de materiales en su volqueta a través de las veredas del municipio de El Santuario posibilitando el desplazamiento de las encomiendas hasta las distintas áreas del municipio.
Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, vive en unión libre con su compañera y sostiene a sus dos hijos menores.
Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su vehículo ya que es su único medio de trabajo.
Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su volqueta y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la integridad de sus cargas.
Apoya a Norbey con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Norbey is a hard working and organized man. He earns a living lending the service of transporting materials in his dumper truck through the lanes of the municipality of El Santuario making it possible to move parcels to other areas of the municipality.
He is a kind, helpful and very entrepreneurial man. He lives with his partner and he supports two young children.
He is asking for this loan for the upkeep and repair of his vehicle as it is his only form of work.
With this loan he will be able to improve the conditions of his truck and will be able to continue to lend his services with complete security and without putting at risk his life or the integrity of his cargo.
Help Norbey with a loan today!

loans.use: to maintain his dumper truck.

loans.name: Livie Grace

texts.en:
Livie Grace is a 29-year-old married woman and the mother of a six-year-old child. She lives with her family in Isabel, Leyte.

Livie Grace is engaged in retail sales of gasoline, ready-to-wear clothes, and prepaid loads. This is the source of her income. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes, gasoline, and prepaid loads to sell.

This loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Livie Grace hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, gasoline, and prepaid loads to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 49 years old, from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with two children ages 16 and 30. For 28 years now, she has been engaged in selling snacks such as steamed rice cake in her community. In addition to food vending, she is also into buying and selling livestock to earn a living. Josephine is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and cattle. With your loan, Josephine’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will result in an increase of their income. In the future, she plans to expand her business to be more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and cattle

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been running a retail shop for four years now. She works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Leah's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the retail shop inventory and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase the shop inventory. She dreams of being a successful person.

Leah will make sure she pays back her loan on time.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She lives in Leyte, Philippines. For eleven years, Lourdes has been engaged in a hog-raising business. Lourdes is standing in front of the pigpen together with her youngest daughter.

Hog-raising is the source of her income. Lourdes is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed. A loan will allow Lourdes to improve her business as well as her income.

In the future, Lourdes hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various household commodities like pouch soy sauce, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods, beverages and soap. She is 41-year-old married woman with nine children and is from Mayorga, Leyte. Her oldest child is 23 and the youngest is two years old.

Aida is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries like noodles, toiletries, beverages, and seasonings. These items will help improve the merchandise offered by her store, which will entice more consumers to shop and purchase there. Eventually, Aida will slowly gain a profit, and she will use it to roll the capital into another business venture, to have another supplemental income supporting her family.

In the future, she will try her best to expand her business to make it successful and to be able to support the needs of her growing children, especially sending them all to receive a college education.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries like noodles, toiletries, beverages, and seasonings

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita lives with her husband and two sons in Lusakert village, Shirak region. She is a hardworking farmer with many years of experience running a farm. On her farm, Rita keeps a livestock of cows, calves, sheep and hens and also organizes the cultivation of potato. To be able to enlarge her potato production harvest in the spring, Rita asks for this loan. She plans to purchase 5,000 kg of potato seeds for her farm. 

Rita, with a good credit history behind her, hopes for the lenders’ support.

loans.use: to purchase 5,000 kg of potato seeds for her farm

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a farmer. He toils the land and grows rice. He is a married man with six children, from Dulag, Leyte. Two of his children are still attending school. To have an additional source of income, he raises hogs.  He has been engaged in this kind of business for 12 years now.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seedlings, and pesticides, and to purchase piglets and pig feed. These materials will be essential in starting  his livelihood again. Alejandro could now improve the quality of his yield, and raise and sell more pigs in the coming few months. He could now start to pay his daily expenses and other obligations.

In the future, he is hoping that he could augment both of his businesses to support the needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seedlings, and pesticides, and to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is a teacher working at a local secondary school in Akner village, Syuniq region. She lives in the village with her only daughter who is 25 years old. 
Besides teaching, Anush is also involved in agriculture. She owns a small but beautiful farm where cows, calves, and hens are raised. On the plot of land, Anush also cultivates some haricot and potato, and sells the harvest in local markets. To enlarge her farming business and make it sustainable, Anush has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her to purchase a cow and forage for the livestock. This loan will greatly ease Anush’s work on the farm and will help her to develop it further.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and forage for the livestock needed for the farm

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is from Baghramyan village. She lives with her husband and two children. Ani, with the help of her husband, is engaged in the cultivation of wheat and breeding of cows, sheep, and calves.

To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Ani needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase two cows and fertilizer. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Ani was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Ani and her husband will be thankful to all lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
David de 68 años de edad estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, es casado y tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y por las tardes se dedica a cuidar el ganado y ordeñarlo. Solo ella y su hija viven con él. David es agricultor y productor ganadero, tiene muchos años de experiencia pues desde que era niño su padre lo llevaban a trabajar al campo para que aprendiera y algún día viviera de eso. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar dos novillas que espera sean buenas productoras de leche para mejorar el negocio en que se involucra su esposa y vende la leche entre los vecinos. Sueña que con el trabajo agrícola y el buen funcionamiento del ganado tenga los suficientes ingresos para dar estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
Davíd, who is 68 years old, went to school through the 9th grade of basic education. He is married and has a 15-year-old daughter. His wife is a housewife, and in the afternoons she cares for the livestock and milks the cows. Only she and their daughter live with him. Davíd is a farmer and livestock producer. He has many years of experience, since his father took him to work in the fields when he was very young, so that he would learn and someday live from this.

He is applying for the loan to purchase two heifers, which he hopes will be good producers of milk, in order to improve the business that his wife is involved in, in which she sells the milk to the neighbors. He dreams that with the agricultural work and the good performance of the livestock, he will have sufficient income to educate his daughter.

loans.use: to buy two heifers

loans.name: Arine

texts.en:
Arine runs a university canteen in Kapan town. She lives with her husband and two little kids and works hard to help her husband with the family’s living costs.

Arine seeks this loan to purchase a refrigerator and gas boiler needed for her canteen. She also needs to purchase some food supplies, as the number of clients is expected to gradually increase during the holiday season. Arine greatly hopes for lenders’ support and trust in her small business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and gas boiler needed for her canteen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a sanitation system for his house.

loans.name: Union En Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
Angela is the coordinator of the Union En Progreso (Union on progress) 1 group, which is based in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic that has unreliable access to resources such as potable running water and electricity. 

Angela runs a Fantasia, which is a small general store in the neighborhood where people can find jewelry, accessories, cosmetics, underwear, and other products like clothes or shoes. She has proven she is an excellent Esperanza client by repaying 13 loans. She plans to use this loan, her 14th, to continue to grow her business and to buy more miscellaneous products to resell. She will buy women's accessories, cosmetics, clothes, etc. She hopes to someday have a bigger store. 

Angela would like to use the money she earns in her business to continue improving her business and to save for her future. The loans she has taken with Esperanza in the past have helped her to provide for her family: her three children and her long-term partner.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, and other products

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en:
This is Arpik’s first loan. She is a farmer, with experience running a farm for 20 years. Arpik keeps livestock of cows, calves, hens and beehives. She gets milk and meat, as well as honey, which she sells in the local markets. 

Arpik lives with her husband and 22-year-old son who helps her with selling the products in the market.
 
Arpik wants to enlarge her farm with one cow and purchase forage for feeding the livestock. That’s the reason Arpik is asking for this loan. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to enlarge her farm with one cow and purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ever Oswaldo

texts.es:
Ever de 30 años de edad estudió hasta bachillerato, es casado y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa pero le apoya en las actividades que realiza. Ever es empleado y trabaja como chofer de una ambulancia, lo hace durante 5 días a la semana doce horas al día, tiene 4 años trabajando de esta manera y le llena de satisfacción saber que su trabajo ayuda a las personas.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para reparar el techo de su casa que está muy dañado y quiere mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ever is 30 years old and studied up until the high school certificate, he is married and has a four year old son. Ever's wife is a stay-at-home Mom but she also helps Ever in what he does. 

Ever is employed and works as an ambulance driver five days a week, twelve hours a day. He has been working in this job for four years and is very satisfied to know that his work helps people. 

Ever is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to repair the roof of his house. The roof is very damaged and he wants to improve, little by little, the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is from Sasnashen village, Aragatsotn region, where she lives with her brother. Their only occupation is agriculture. Their family farm, which they run, includes livestock of cows, calves, sheep, pig and hens. The milk that is gathered Silva uses in cheese production and other dairy products, and her brother sells it in the market. 
 
To purchase forage for the livestock, Silva has applied for this loan. This is very important for the farm to function well and to be prepared for cold. The loan is important for Silva and her brother, and they both hope for your support.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock

loans.name: Gs. La Luz 1 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of her group, GS. La Luz 1 (The light). This solidarity group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry and which, like other cities in the Dominican Republic, has unreliable access to running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. 

Lourdes makes her home there in a simple structure with her three children. She is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Lourdes sells different kinds of jewelry like stainless, gold-filled and silver, and women's accessories. With this loan, she will increase her inventory by buying a large variety of jewelry like necklaces, rings, bracelets, earrings, etc. She will use the profits to improve her home and invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bracelets, rings, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails for a new roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet, wood, nails, and wire, to finish building a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Albertina tiene 51 años y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija. Albertina, se gana la vida por medio de la venta de pollos, cerdos  y pavos. La venta la realiza desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como apoya en la economía del hogar y junto a su compañero de vida dan a sus hijos lo necesario. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor de su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará  lámina galvanizada, hierro, madera, etc.
texts.en: Albertina is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. Albertina earns a living selling chickens, pigs, and turkeys. She has been selling for a long time and it is in this way she supports her home and with her husband gives her children what they need, With the desire to improve their living conditions she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to construct a corridor in her home. with the loan she will buy galvanized laminate, iron, wood, etc.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, iron, wood, etc. to construct a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Davud

texts.en:
Davud has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives with his family in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. His son finished college and now he wants to enter university. His wife is a housewife.

Now Davud has started a new business and he needs a loan of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy enough hay for his cattle. In his business usually he buys little calves, raises them, and sells the cattle in a local bazaar. Davud is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him. He wants to increase his business and monthly income in the future.

loans.use: to buy hay and increase his business; in future he wants to help his son study at university.

loans.name: Balasan

texts.en:
This is Balasan’s second loan from Kiva. With the help of her first loan, Balasan was able to pay for her daughter Hasmik’s university tuition for the first year of study. 

After paying the first loan back responsibly, Balasan now asks lenders to support her with the second year tuition fee for Hasmik. As a very responsible client, she relies on lenders’ goodwill, and hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en:
Burastan is from the Armavir region in Lernamerdz village. She lives with her husband and two children (9-year-old son and 8-year-old daughter). Burastan’s husband works at a local poultry factory, so the main work on the farm lies with Burastan. Due to her hard work, Burastan manages to take care of the household, school-aged children and the farm. On her small but beautiful farm, she keeps a cow and two calves, and grows different greens in the greenhouse (tarragon, etc.). 
To be able to prepare the greenhouse for the cold, Burastan needs to purchase polyethylene covers, pipes and other materials for renovating it. That’s the reason she asks for this loan of USD 1,500.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene covers, pipes and other materials for renovating her greenhouse

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar lives in Ararat region, Dvin village with her big family of her husband, father-in-law, sister-in-law, two daughters and a son. Gohar and her family have been involved in agriculture for 10 years so far. The main income of the family comes from selling fruits. They own a big refrigerator where they keep a big variety of fruits and resell them during the season.  To be able to purchase new stock of fruits in bulk, Gohar has applied for this loan. She relies on lenders’ support and hopes to reinvest the gathered revenue to the business and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of fruits in bulk (pomegranate, apple)

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is 55 years old and lives in the village Tsav of Syunik region. Armen is not married, and he lives with his retired father. Armen used to work as a house painter, but now he does farming and agriculture. On his plot of land he raises potato, carrot, cabbage, and beans, which he sells to re-sellers with the help of his father. He has a few cattle (two cows and two calves) and sells milk and meat from his farm. Since Armen wants to enlarge his farm he decided to cooperate with Kiva and Nor Horizon. With this loan he wants to buy two heifers and animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two heifers and animal fodder

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is from Vernashen village. She lives there with her son who is electrician by his profession. 

Seda has been running her family farm for many years. The farm is small but sustainable enough to help Seda cover their daily costs. To enlarge her livestock by one cow and forage for feeding the livestock, Seda has applied for this loan of USD 2,100.
 
She will be very thankful if lenders help her loan to be funded.

loans.use: To enlarge her livestock by one cow and purchase forage for feeding the livestock

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Josue Elíu

texts.es:
Josué de 25 años de edad solo pudo estudiar hasta 7° grado de educación básica, está acompañado y tiene dos hijo pero todavía no estudian su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijo dependen de él.

Josué es agricultor y tiene 10 años de experiencia trabajando con maíz, pero cuando no es época de siembra se dedica a comerciar con ganado, este año al igual que los anteriores solicita el préstamo para comprar ganado, que será engordado y posteriormente vendido, esta actividad la repite hasta llegar la época en que él siembra nuevamente. Como en años anteriores espera le resulte la inversión para utilizar el dinero de la venta para cultivar.
texts.en:
