Liza is a 44-year-old, married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liza has a vegetable-selling business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 42 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, cooking oil, beers, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, cooking oil, beers, etc. Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, cooking oil, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Efrain Antonio

texts.es:
Efraín, es casado, actualmente solo vive con dos hijos, por medio de amistades aprendió a ofrecer el servicio de transporte, posteriormente ya con experiencia, sacrificio y esfuerzos logro adquirir una unidad de transporte propia, su negocio ha evolucionado de buena manera pues hoy cuenta con permisos para transportar alumnos desde su casa a la escuela, hacer viajes a diferentes lugares del país y también con una línea de circulación en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que desempeña desde hace 9 años, por el momento no tienen dificultades en el negocio.
Contará con recursos para comprar llantas, bujías, luces, fajas y otros repuestos para su unidad de transporte, reparará y dará mantenimiento a su equipo de trabajo de manera inmediata para seguir dando un servicio de calidad y con mucha seguridad. 
Sus sueños son reducir sus deudas, tener otra unidad de transporte y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Efraín is married, but is currently living with just his two children. He learned the business of providing transportation services from some friends. With experience, hard work, and sacrifice, he obtained his own vehicle and since then, his business has been evolving nicely. He now has permits to transport children from their homes to school, make trips to various locations within the country, and also drive a circuit around the center of the city. He's run this business for nine years now and he's not currently experiencing any difficulties.

He needs this loan so that he can purchase tires, spark plugs, lights, belts and other parts for his vehicle. He will use these to immediately repair and maintain the equipment he needs for his job so that he can continue to provide safe, high-quality service. His goals are to reduce his debt, buy another vehicle, and get his children ahead.

loans.use: buy parts to maintain and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Ada Patricia

texts.es:
Ada, está mejorando su negocio y solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en quesos, quesillo, crema, requesón, bebidas, boquitas, etc., ofrecerá lácteos para tener mejores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Para Ada el préstamo anterior ha sido de utilidad para mejorar la mercadería que oferta en su tienda, sus clientes han aumentado y brinda una vida más cómoda a su familia.
texts.en:
Ada is improving her business and requesting a new loan to invest in cheese, cheese curds, cream, cottage cheese, drinks, sandwiches, etc. She will offer dairy products in order to have a better income and to satisfy her clients' demand.
For Ada, her previous loan was very useful. She improved her merchandise, her clientele has expanded, and she has been able to offer her family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to invest in cheese, cheese curds, drinks, sandwiches etc.

loans.name: Yamb Yel  Benewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme  TENE  est responsable du groupe  YAMB YEL BENEWENDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgés à 11 ans. Les 03 vont  à l’école.
Mme  fait restauration (haricot) et vend de condiments depuis  10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter  02 sacs haricot, 01sac de riz et 01bidon d'huile.	
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour scolariser ses enfants. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tene is responsible for the group Yamb Yel Benewende. She is doing well. She is the married mother of four children. The oldest is 23 years old and the youngest is 11. Three of them attend school.

She is a caterer (beans) and has been selling condiments for the past ten years. She resupplies at the local market and wants to buy two bags of beans, one bag of rice and one container of cooking oil.

She would like to use her profits to ensure her children's education, expand her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: buy two bags of beans, one bag of rice and one container of cooking oil

loans.name: Luis Daniel

texts.es:
Luis tiene 20 años, es soltero, no tiene carga familiar. Su familia es unida, vive en casa familiar con su madre y hermano. Persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. Vive en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Luis se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte de mototaxi en la zona central del distrito y alrededores, cuenta con 02 años de experiencia en el sector. El préstamo será utilizado para invertir en un negocio de comida, con esto busca generar ingresos adicionales a su actividad en el sector transporte, lo cual le reportará un mayor ingreso mensual, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 20 years old, single, and does not have dependents. His family is close; he lives in the family home with his mother and brother. He is a person with good personal and work references in the district. He lives in the district of Zaña, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The district’s population makes a living from agriculture and stockbreeding.

Luis makes a living by providing motorcycle taxi transportation services in the central zone of the district and the surrounding areas. He has 2 years of experience in the sector. The loan will be used to invest in a food business. With this, he seeks to generate an income additional to his activity in the transportation sector, which will yield a higher monthly income to him, improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in a food business.

loans.name: Ross Meri

texts.es:
Ross Meri tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su menor hija en una casa alquilada, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un local céntrico del distrito. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El presente crédito será utlizado como capital de trabajo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio, con lo cual busca poder ampliar su negocio, atendiendo a una mayor cantidad de clientes y otorgar una mejor atención, con esto podrá aumentar sus ventas y así aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ross Meri, 38, is a single mother who lives with her youngest daughter in a rented house in Cayalti, Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The people of this area work in trade and agriculture.

Ross Meri sells food in the center of the district.  She has a lot of good references, both as a person and as a professional. She will use the current loan to buy chairs and tables for her business.  This will help her to increase her business by serving more customers and offering them a better service.  The profits she earns will be used to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her catering business.

loans.name: Gilmer Edgardo

texts.es:
Gilmer tiene 52 años de edad, es conviviente sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Gilmer se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su moto carguera, tiene 2 años de experiencia en el sector, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. El crédito será utilizado para invertir en activo fijo y mantenimiento de su moto, para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con esto logrará obtener mayores ingresos, lo cual incrementará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gilmer, 52, lives with his partner but has no children to look after.  He lives in his own house in Cayalti, Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.  The people in this area work in trade, livestock and agriculture.  

Gilmer offers a transportation service with his motorbike and trailer.  He has two years' experience in this sector and he runs his business from his home.  

He will use the loan to invest in fixed assets and to carry out maintenance work on his motorbike.  This will allow him to offer his customers a better service and generate more income, which will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets and maintain his motorbike.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a 43-year-old married mother of three children from Isabel, Leyte. She is engaged in retail sales of fruits and vegetables. Elma has been in the business for more than five years now. Elma is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell to the market. A loan will enable her to improve her business as well as her income and profit. Elma’s future plans include the expansion of her store and its sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell to the market

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 44 years old and blessed three school-aged children. She has been in a rental housing business for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy materials for painting and renovating the rental houses. 

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business

loans.use: to buy more materials for painting and renovating rental houses

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
Jerelyn is 48 years old and a married mother of four children, ages 11 to 17. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has many customers but sometimes she lacks items they need. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more grocery items including detergent, bath soap, coffee, shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods and noodles to provide customers with what they need. The loan will allow her to buy merchandise in bulk, thus increasing her income and providing a better quality of life for her family.
In the future, Jerelyn will strive to make her business better and more successful so she can provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bath soap, coffee, shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Teofilo Adrian

texts.es:
Teofilo Adrian tiene 22 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz, con una experiencia en el rubro de 04 años. Cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en mantenimiento de su cultivo con la compra de abono y fertilizantes. Esta inversión le permitirá mayores ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Teofilo Adrian is 22 years old.  He lives in his own house made of rustic material together with his spouse and their two younger children in the district of Pucará, located in the province of Jaén, region Cajamarca, in the northern highlands of Peru.  The community where he lives is a small rural area where the inhabitants primarily make a living in agriculture, livestock, and trade.

He makes a living in agriculture, specifically in growing corn, with an experience in the business for four years.  He has regular customers who give him very good personal and work references.

He will use the loan to invest in maintaining his crop by buying manure and fertilizers.  This loan will allow him greater profits to improve economic conditions and therefore invest in better conditions of life.

loans.use: To invest in maintaining his crop by buying manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en: Len, 34, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, one is in school. She earns income to support her family by rice cropping and working for others for a fee. She can earn about 24,000 KHR per day. For Len, this is her second loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay laborers for harvesting and to buy some household supplies. She hopes that she can a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To pay laborers for harvesting and to buy some household supplies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Simleng's Group

texts.en: A local famer from Kampong Cham province, Simleng is 44 years old and the mother of two children. To support her family, she grows rice on one hectare of land and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She can earn about 22,200 KHR per day. This is her fifth loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions and to buy a decent motorbike.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable and spice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and a general store. Susan  is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables and spices to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables and spices business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Deocena

texts.en:
Deocena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Deocena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Deocena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Feliciana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She has been in this business for 13 years now. Feliciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 42 years old and married with seven children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000  through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Elvira has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one and a half years, and also earns an income from farming rice and raising livestock.

She aspires to saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is single and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Adriana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Adriana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to  purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Adriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 29 years old and married with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.  

Edelyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from pig fattening and buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Edelyn aspires to saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: La Sagesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente NSHOMBO est mariée à un mécanicien, mère de 9 enfants tous allant à l’école et présidente du groupe  LA SAGESSE. Elle s’occupe de la vente de pétrole au marché centrale de la ville. Elle vient de solliciter un nouveau pret qui lui servira d’acheter 10 bidons de 25 litres de pétrole pour qu’à l’avenir le benefice de son activité l'aide à contruire sa maison, agrandir son entreprise et payer les frais scolaires  de ses enfants. Elle remercie de tout cœur HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en:
The client Nshombo is married to a mechanic. She is the mother of nine children all of whom attend school, and is the president of the La Sagesse group.

She sells gasoline  in the city's main market. She just requested a new loan she will use buy ten 25-liter cans of gasoline.

She is hoping that the profits from her business activity will help her build her house, expand her business and pay for her children's school fees.

She wholeheartedly thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: buy ten 25-liter cans of gasoline

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, la población se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado, además de la agricultura y comercio.

Narcisa se dedica a la producción de plátano y crianza y venta de animales (ganado caprino), tiene 15 años de experiencia en el sector y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de activos biológicos que usará en la siembra de plátano, para poder obtener un buena cosecha y así poder ofrecer su producción a un mejor precio, aumentando sus ingresos, mejorando sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 41 years old, is a single mother. She lives with her two minor children in the Buenos Aires district of Morropón province, located in the Piura region of the northern coast of Peru. Life is quiet in the area, where people work raising livestock as well as in agriculture and commerce.

Narcisa grows bananas, and she also raises and sells animals (goats). She has 15 years of experience in this work, with very good personal and work references.

This loan is to buy biological assets that she will use with her banana crops to get a good harvest. This way she will be able to offer her products at a better price, increase the income, improve the profits, and thus improve her quality of life and that of her children.

loans.use: to buy biological assets for use with her banana crops.

loans.name: Percita

texts.en:
Percita is 50 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Percita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies. Percita has been farming rice  for five years, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of  saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, chips, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns income from food vending.

Evelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, chips, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear to sell for her business. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

Jocelyn also earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Larena

texts.en:
Larena works hard to support her family. Larena is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Larena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Larena has been in this business for five years now.

Larena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy has a live-in partner and two children who are in school. She is 37 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary Joy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 30 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase consumer goods to sell like shampoo, bread, chips, sugar, etc.  Regine has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase consumer goods to sell like shampoo, bread, chips, sugar, etc

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Rowena has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Pearly works hard to support her family.
She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Pearly is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.
Pearly has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pritse

texts.en:
Pritse is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.
Pritse requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.
Pritse has been in this business for six years now.
In the future, Pritse would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Olivia tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y madre en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral como cuyes, gallinas, patos, ganado caprino, porcino, desde hace más de 05 años, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor producción y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia, logrando aumentar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olivia, 30, lives with together with her son and her mother in Querocotillo, Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountain range of Peru.  The people who live there work in agriculture, with the rice being the most common produce.  They also work in trade and livestock.

Olivia raises and sells farmyard animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, goats, and pigs.  She has been doing this for five years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy animal feed so that she can fatten the animals and then offer better produce to her customers.  This will allow her to generate a better income for her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz comes from Tajikistan and is a married father of two children. Firuz is very hard-working man. He has been busy with servicing and repairing houses for more than 15 years. He has much experience in this field and performs his job well. He is the main breadwinner of his family as his wife is a housewife. Firuz must buy coal for the winter season to keep his house warm but lacks enough money. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy coal for the winter season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy coal for the winter season

loans.name: Ref'at

texts.en:
Ref'at is a 32-year-old married man from Gaza city, where he lives with his wife and four kids. He has a store that sells kids' clothes in the city and has been open for the past three years. It is a very good business and the demand is very high. 
Ref'at took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection for his clothes store to resell. By taking out this loan, Ref'at will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 
Ref'at appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new collection for his clothes store to resell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 50 años, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge, hijos y sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores comno cerdos y patos, desde hace más de 05 años. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como patos y cerdos para su negocio así como alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Luz Marina tiene como objetivo mejorar la productividad de su negocio lo que le reportará mayores niveles de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 50 years old. She lives in the family house with her spouse, children, and her own parents. They live in the Cayaltí district, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Perú. She lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and livestock. 

She has been raising and selling small animals such as pigs and ducks for more than 5 years. Her has experience in the business and very good personal and professional references in the area.

The loan will be for the purchase of more animals such as ducks and pigs for her business. It will also be used to buy a balanced diet for them. Her goal is to improve the productivity of her business. It will give her better earnings and will allow Luz Marina to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more animals (such as ducks and pigs) for her business, as well as a balanced diet for them.

loans.name: Salice

texts.en:
47-year-old Salice is a sari-sari store owner from the community of Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with four dependents, ages 15 to 18. 

Salice has been selling basic items to the community for 29 years now. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory and to attract more customers. She will use the loan to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, shampoo, and bath soap. 

Salice knows how a store that looks full attracts more buyers than the ones that lack a display. She plans to make her store bigger, for greater profitability.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, shampoo, and bath soap.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe is a machine shop owner from Estancia, Iloilo. She is 55 years old and has been in this business for 33 years. This business has been instrumental in raising her 10 grown children. Among them is her youngest who is 18 and still studying.  Ma. Fe is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy acetylene, acetylene oxygen, welding rod, spray gun, sander cutter, electric drill and other tools. Ma. Fe is determined and hard working. She would like to earn income on her own and hopes to make her business even more successful someday. Her income goes for healthy meals, pays her child’s tuition, goes into savings and is reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to  buy acetylene, acetylene oxygen, welding rod, spray gun, sander cutter, electric drill and other tools

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en: Zeny is from Estancia, Iloilo. She is 49 years old and married with three adult children. For two years, she has been dependent on income from her sari-sari (variety) store business and from farming corn. Zeny is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store like candies, biscuits, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs and coffee. She also plan to use some of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Her profit will sustain the needs of her family, like food, and pay for basic household bills, like electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs and coffee

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 65 years old and works hard as a dressmaker to earn a living.
She has been in the business of making and mending dresses for 45 years now. She is asking a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy cloth and beads so she can work on her pending orders. This will motivate Vilma to continue making the most of her livelihood. Her income will go for a healthy diet, savings and reinvestment in her business.  Vilma lives in Estancia, Iloilo.

loans.use: to buy cloth and beads

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar frutas y verduras frescas, además invertirá en carne para diversificar su negocio, espera atraer nuevos clientes y tener ingresos extras.
EL financiamiento anterior le dio recursos económicos para ofrecer productos de calidad y mantener su negocio en el mercado, su familia mantiene óptimas condiciones de salud y su nueva situación económica le ha permitido comprar artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca is asking for a new loan to buy fresh fruit and vegetables.  She would also like to buy some meat so that she can diversify her business and attract new customers, which will hopefully bring her more income.  

Her previous loan gave her the financial aid necessary to buy quality products and keep her business running in the market.  

Her family is in good health and her better economic situation has allowed her to buy some products for the home.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables, as well as meat to offer more variety in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 60 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Marilyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of rice to sell .

Marilyn has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: David Enrique

texts.es:
David, es acompañado, tiene dos hijas las cuales tienen 3 años y son gemelas, su esposa es empleada en una arrocera y le colabora con los gastos de su hogar, por su parte David se dedica  a brindar el servicio de transporte público, negocio que su padre inicio y posteriormente se lo heredo,  trabaja de lunes a sábado, de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche, por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
El capital que requiere lo utilizará para comprar llantas nuevas, dar mantenimiento al sistema eléctrico y tapizar los asientos de su unidad de transporte, así ofrecerá seguridad y comodidad a sus clientes, pretende ganar mayor popularidad para incrementar sus ganancias.
Las aspiraciones de David son continuar mejorando su unidad de transporte, comprar una unidad nueva y dar la educación adecuada a sus hijas.
texts.en:
David has a partner and two daughters, three-year-old twins. His partner is an employee for a rice producer, and she helps with the household expenses. 

David earns a living providing public transportation services, it is a business that his father started up and eventually passed on to him. He works Mondays to Saturdays from 6 am to 8 Pm. Currently his business presents no difficulties.

He's asking for capital to buy new tires, maintain the electrical system, and upholster the seats of his vehicle. He will offer safety and comfort to his customers, looking to gain more popularity in order to increase profits.

David aspires to continue improving his vehicle, buy a new one, and also give his daughters a proper education.

loans.use: to buy new tires, maintain the electrical system, and upholster the seats of his vehicle, so that he can offer safety and comfort to his clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair her sandwich cart and purchase supplies to make and sell her food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her husband's clothes selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a widowed woman with nine children. She is 59 years old, and two of her children are still in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Narcisa has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.  Narcisa has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is 40 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Julieta has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of goods to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 55 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Tita has a general store business in the Philippines. Tita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like shampoo, hair conditioner, detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, and bath soap to sell.
She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.
Tita has been in this business for three years. Tita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like shampoo, hair conditioner, detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, and bath soap to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family. Luciana is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Luciana requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Luciana has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Luciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and married with six children. With one of her children currently in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lydia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, juice, milk, canned goods, fabric conditioners, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. 

Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cherylyn

texts.en:
Cherylyn works hard to support her family. Cherylyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
Cherylyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.
Cherylyn has been in this business for five years now.
Cherylyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Em-Em

texts.en:
Em-Em is a 28-year-old, married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Em-Em has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear like skirts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Em-Em would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear like skirts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 46 years old and has three children. Erlinda is married and has one child who is currently in school.
Erlinda is in the agricultural, pig fattening business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested an PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Erlinda has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana works hard to support her family. Cipriana is married and has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines.
Cipriana requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.
Cipriana has been in this business for six years now.
In the future, Cipriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Utii Group

texts.fr: Madame CIZA est présidente du groupe UTII à l'age de 34ans. Mariée à un homme d'affaire,mère de 5enfants scolarisés,elle exerce le commerce des boissons depuis 2007 suite au premier fonds reçu de son mari. Elle vient de demander un nouveau crédit pour acquérir 10 casiers de Primus, 7 casiers de sucré et payer le transport en vue d’ouvrir un grand dépôt dans l’avenir. Elle remercie vivement HEKIMA pour son coup de main.
texts.en:
At 34 years old, Mrs. Ciza is the president of the Utii group. Married to a businessman, and mother of five children all in school, she has been retailing beverages since 2007, following a first funding from her husband.

She just requested a new loan to buy ten cases of Primus (beer), seven cases of soft drinks and pay for transportation, and hopes to open a large depot in the future.

She warmly thanks HEKIMA for its helping hand.

loans.use: buy ten cases of Primus (beer), seven cases of soft drinks and pay for transportation

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Crislyn is a 31-year-old married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Crislyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Crislyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Efrenita

texts.en:
Efrenita is 53 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Efrenita works very hard to provide for them.

Efrenita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like cooking oil, eggs, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.  Efrenita has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, eggs, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. 

Efrenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like cooking oil, eggs, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
Ángel, de 68 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Tienen 4 hijos, ninguno vive con ellos.

Ángel, es agricultor y se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, ajonjolí, verduras y algunas hortalizas.- Se ha dedicado a es esta actividad desde hace 43 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre ya que desde pequeño le  enseño a cultivar.

Ángel, no tiene otra actividad económica, su lugar de trabajo está cerca de su casa, lo que más se le dificulta a Ángel, es transportar los insumos agrícolas, ya que vive en una zona bastante aislado del municipio más cercano.- En el trabajo se involucra un nieto de él, el horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día aproximadamente.


Ángel, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, para fertilizar el maíz, ellos viven cerca de un rio, esto les ayuda porque la humedad ayuda a que crezcan más rápido los granos de maíz y frijol, todos están en etapa  de crecimiento y necesitan la  fertilización.

El préstamo mejorará la producción, porque abonará a tiempo y con esto podrá asegurar la alimentación de su familia.

Los sueños de Ángel, son seguir cultivando la tierra ya que ha sido el elemento que le ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito será una herramienta para mejorar la productividad de su negocio y mejorar los ingresos, con la ganancia espera comprar bueyes, que necesita para seguir cultivando la tierra.
texts.en:
Angel, 68 years old, studied until the third grade. He is married and his wife makes a living from the domestic trade. They have 4 children, none of which live with them.

Angel is a farmer and he makes a living from cultivating corn, beans, sesame, vegetables, and some leafy vegetables. He has made a living from this activity for 43 years. He learned this activity from his father since he taught him to farm when he was small.

Angel does not have any other economic activity. His place of work is close to his home. That which is most difficult for him is transporting agricultural supplies since he lives in a zone that is very isolated from the closest town. One of his grandsons is involved in the business. His work schedule is 5 hours a day, approximately.

Angel needs the loan to purchase fertilizer to fertilize the corn. They live near a river. This helps them because the wetness helps the corn and beans to grow more quickly. They are all in a stage of growth and they need the fertilization. The loan will improve the production because he will fertilize the crops on time and with this will be able to assure the feeding of his family.

Angel’s dream is to continue cultivating the land since it has been the element that has served him to bring his family out ahead.

The loan will be a tool to improve his business’s productivity and to improve his income. With the profits, he hopes to purchase oxen, which he needs to continue cultivating the land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: ELMER: Es originario de Waspam Río Coco, tiene 32 años, casado con dos hijos: El mayor de ocho años de edad estudia su segundo grado de primaria y un pequeño de cuatro años de edad. Es un microempresario, con 15 años de experiencia como pequeño comerciante. Está solicitando financiamiento para aumentar el inventario de los productos de granos básicos, gaseosas, detergentes, leche en polvo entre otros, que vende en su  pulpería. Su sueño es llegar a tener una distribuidora de productos que le genere más ganancia y poder  crear las condiciones que le permitan a el y a su familia tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer is from Waspan, Río Coco, and is 32 years old. He is married and has two children. The oldest, who is eight years old, is in the second grade. The little one is four years old.

Elmer is a small business owner and has 15 years of experience as a small shopkeeper. He is asking for financing to increase his product inventory with basic grains, sodas, detergents, powdered milk, and more. He sells these is his convenience store. His dream is to have product distribution that will generate more earnings, and to be able to create the conditions that will allow him and his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to increase product inventory: basic grains, sodas, detergents, powdered milk, and more.

loans.name: Rosas De Pulay 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana
Ana´s mother died when she was eight years old, she do not remember her. She was raised by her father. She only studied four years of elementary school.
Ana and her husband initiated a TV Cable Service four years ago with their first loan. The idea was to install TV Cable Service in the village they live. In their first year their first loan was utilized to buy materials and made the installation of cable around their house.
The worth of mouth communication provoked that people of other villages around their own village, began asking if they could have the service. For this year, their fourth operation year, they expect to have around 300 TV cable users. Now their business involve all the members of Ana and her husband family. The loans obtained from Chajulense Association of Women United for Life have been used to expand their Cable TV business.
Ana is the leader of group Rosas de Pulay 1. The group is integrated by seven women, they are from Ethnicity Ixil Maya, and they will invest their loans in retail, services and food activities. On average they have 3 children. Their average loan amount is Q 5,500.

loans.use: To expand their TV cable busines

loans.name: Idis Valeska

texts.es:
Idis es una señora casada, con un  pequeño hijo a su cargo, y se desempeña como maestra de ducacion primaria desde hace dos años de laborar en una Escuela en la Zona rural donde habita con su familia.
Actualmente esta señora se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel par solicitar su segundio financiamiento el cual lo utilizaria compra de ocho bolsa de cemento para embaldosar la cocina, compra de una puerta y una ventana para su vivienda, lo que le vendria a dar seguridad  a su vivienda  , mejor nivel y condiciones de vida en su seno familiar.
texts.en:
Idis, a married mother of a young son, has worked as a teacher in primary school for the last two years in a school in the rural area where she lives with her family.

Currently, this woman approached the Ceprodel communal bank to request a second loan, which she will use to buy eight bags of cement to add tiles to the kitchen, a door and some windows for her home. This will provide security for her home and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy 8 bags of cement to add tiles to the kitchen, a door and some windows for her home.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Amistad  esta en su ciclo 17, forma parte del programa de eliminacion de la pobreza, está luchando y esforzandose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien se encuentra en un nivel extremo de pobreza, es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante e ir mejorando su vida y sus condiciones de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas, que vende forma ambulante y con lo cual ayuda a su familia.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas frescas de estaciones, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por su familia. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called 'La Amistad' are in their 17th cycle and are part of the program for the elimination of poverty.  They are striving for better living conditions for themselves and their families.  

One of the members is Lidia, who is in the extreme level of poverty.  She is a hard-working woman who wants to be successful and improve her life and standard of living.  She sells fresh fruit on the street which allows her to help her family.  

She is asking for this loan to buy seasonal fruit so that she can continue selling and working hard for her family.  She is very grateful for the opportunity to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive con su cónyugue y sus tres menores hijos en el distrito de Púcara, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura y comercio.

Catalina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con 03 años de experiencia en el rubro y tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes, surtiendo su negocio con nuevos productos e incrementando su stock, con ello generará mayores ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina is 44 year old and lives in a home that she owns made of rustic materials.  She lives with her spouse and their three young children in the Púcara district in the Jaén province in the Catamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  The people of this area work in agriculture and commerce.  Catalina works selling groceries.  Her business is located in her home and she has 3 years of experience in the business.  She has great personal and professional references in the region.  

The loan that she is seeking will be used to purchase a large amount of groceries so that she can stock her business with new products.  She hopes to increase her earnings and improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: purchase a large amount of groceries to stock her business with new products.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y un hermano. Francisco es un hombre emprendedor quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta de verduras las cuales distribuye de forma ambulante. Este negocio es el que le permite apoyar en la economía del hogar. Francisco ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, etc. dado que desea reparar las paredes de un cuarto de su vivienda, dado que con el tiempo las paredes se han deteriorado.
texts.en:
Francisco, 33, lives in his own house with his mother and one brother.  He is an enterprising man who earns a living selling vegetables which he offers on the streets.  This business allows him to contribute to the household expenses.  

He has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron because he would like to repair the walls of one of the rooms in his house.  These walls have deteriorated over time.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron so he can repair the walls in his house.

loans.name: Jose Baltazar

texts.es:
Jose tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura y comercio.

Jose se dedica a la actividad de transporte en mototaxi, con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio. Tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El préstamo será utilizado para la reparación de su mototaxi, dicha inversión le ayudará a mejorar su vehículo para así brindar un mejor servicio, lo cual aumentará su cantidad de clientes, aumentando sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old, single, and lives in his own house in Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. The population in the district works in agriculture and trade.

José works providing transportation in a motorcycle taxi, with more than 5 years of experience in the business. He has good personal and work references. The loan will be used to do some repairs on his motorcycle taxi. This investment will help him to improve his vehicle to, in this way, offer better service, which will increase the number of customers, increasing his income and, in the end, his quality of life.

loans.use: to do repairs on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jose Hiroshi Kiang

texts.es:
Jose tiene 27 años, vive junto a su conviviente y sus hijos en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Jose se dedica al servicio agrícola y servicio de transporte en mototaxi. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y otros insumos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo. Con esto tendrá una mejor producción, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old, and lives with his partner and their children in Zaña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.  The population in the district works in trade, agriculture, and animal husbandry.  

José works in farm services and motorcycle taxi transport. He has very good personal and work references in the district. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, manure, and other supplies to maintain his crop. With this, he will have better production, which will generate more income, improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure and other supplies to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Carlos Amado

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 43 años, su familia es unida, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Carlos se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores como patos, gallinas, etc. Con más de 08 años en el negocio. El préstamo se utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y alimento balanceado para engorde de los mismos, lo que le permitirá tener una mayor producción, aumentando sus ingresos y con ello su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old, his family is close-knit, and he lives in his own house with his spouse in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. The population of the district works in trade, agriculture and animal husbandry.

Carlos works raising and selling small animals such as ducks, hens, etc. with more than 8 years of experience in the business. The loan will be used to purchase a larger number of animals and balanced feed to fatten the animals, which will permit him to have better production, increasing his income and, with that, his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger number of animals and balanced feed for fattening these animals.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad works hard to support her family. Felicidad is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.
Felicidad requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.
Felicidad has been in this business for 12 years now.
Felicidad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Garnet

texts.en:
Garnet is 47 years old and married with one child.
Garnet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.
Garnet has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending and videoke machine rental.
Garnet aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.
Imelda requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.
Imelda has been in this business for 15 years now.
In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support six children. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.
Juanita requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.
She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.
Juanita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ziyiruka Group

texts.fr: Madame MARAMUKE est présidente du groupe ZIHIYIRUKA à l'âgée de 56 ans. Mariée à un chômeur et mère de 8 enfants, elle vend les souliers dans le marché central de la ville. Elle a sollicité un prêt pour lui permettre d’acquérir 3 douzaines de souliers dames et 2 douzaines de souliers hommes. Elle compte payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et améliorer sa capacité d’épargner. Elle tient à remercier HEKIMA pour le soutien indéfectible aux femmes à faibles revenus.
texts.en:
At 56 years old, Mrs. Maramuke is the president of the Zihiyiruka group. Married to an unemployed person and mother of eight children, she sells shoes in the city's central market.

She requested a loan so she could buy 3 dozen ladies' shoes and 2 dozen men's shoes. She plans on paying her children's tuition fees and improve her ability to save.

She wishes to thank Hekima for its unwavering support to low-income women.

loans.use: buy 3 dozen ladies' shoes and 2 dozen men's shoes.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lenie is 46 years old, and  two of her children are currently in school.

Lenie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Lenie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  Lenie has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Lenie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonisa is 51 years old,  and one of her children is still in school.

Leonisa has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. Leonisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell to her customers.  Leonisa has been in this business for 25 years. 

Leonisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 54 years old and married with seven children. With four children still in school, Ludivina works very hard to provide for them.

Ludivina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Ludivina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, milk, shampoo, hair conditioner, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Narcissa

texts.en:
Narcissa works hard to support her family. Narcissa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Narcissa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Narcissa has been in this business for 15 years now.

Narcissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: María Isidora

texts.es:
Maria es una señora casada, y se desempeña como conserje en un colegio donde habita desde hace 10 años de laborar.  Su esposo tiene un pequeño taller de carpinteria en su casa de habitaciòn y su hijo estudia en la universidad  y ademas que estudia le ayuda  a su papà  en el taller en su tiempo  libre.
Actualmente Doña Marìa se acerco a la Oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento numero siete, el cual lo utilizaria para terminar de pagar un carro usado.  ya que  dicho vehiculo le ayudaria a trasladarse y trasladar el material que utiliza su esposo en su taller, lo que vendria a mejorar las condicones  y calidad de vida en su hogar y  ha realizar  con mayor rapidez su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is a married woman who has worked as a caretaker in a school for ten years in the community where she lives. Her husband has a small carpentry shop in their house and their son is a university student and, in addition to studying, he helps in his father's workshop in his free time.

Currently, María is approaching the Ceprodel office to ask for her seventh loan, which will be used to finish paying for a used car, since this vehicle will help her to get around and transport the material that her husband uses in his workshop, which in turn will improve the condition and quality of life in their home and make his work go more quickly.

loans.use: to purchase a used car for personal use.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (pictured) is thirty years old and lives at Chroychangva district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She had been married since 2003 and has two daughters. They are still young.

Sophea has been a weaver for ten years, while her husband has been a construction worker for five years. She would like to apply for a loan to buy silk for her weaving. She hopes that she will increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Osaima

texts.en:
Osaima is a 27-year-old married woman from Jenin. She lives with her husband and three kids. Her husband works as a construction worker where he earns a low income. Osaima is a university student specializing in business administration. She would like to get a BA degree and find a job to help her husband with part of the family expenses.

Osaima took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study and pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Osaima will be able to complete her study and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Osaima appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study and pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза активная трудоспособная жительница района Спитамен. Ей 32 года. Она продвигает жизнь за счет растениеводства. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Россию и теперь Шахноза сама ведет сельскохозяйственную деятельность. Она на небольшом участке земли сеет кукурузу и другие виды сельскохозяйственных культур.
Шахноза живет в районе Спитамен вместе с матерью и 12-летней дочерью. Дочь в настоящее время учится в школе. Шахноза из-за нехватки денежных средст вынуждена получить кредит. Ей необходимо срочно закупить семена кукурузы и минеральные удобрения для проведения посевных работ. Она действительно нуждается в финансовой поддержке, чтобы продолжить деятельность и сохранить истичник дохода.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is an active, able-bodied resident of the Spitamen District. She is 32 years old. She makes a living from crop farming. Her husband left to work abroad in Russia and now Shahnoza runs her agricultural business all by herself. On a small plot of land, she sows corn and other types of crops

Shahnoza lives with her mother and 12-year-old daughter in the Spitamen District. Her daughter currently attends school. Because she does not have enough money, Shahnoza needs to take out a loan. She urgently needs to buy corn seeds and mineral fertilizers for carrying out the sowing season. She truly needs financial support in order to continue her business and preserve her source of income.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.en:
Vasiliy is married and he has two kids. Vasiliy works in Drogobych forestry as a manager making sure that the forest is kept safe. He lives in a house with his family and he is a very responsible and hardworking person. He is doing repairs on his house now.

Vasiliy is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to do repairs in the bathroom. He hopes to make it nicer looking, as well as improve the sanitary conditions in his house.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom and improve the sanitary conditions at his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a larger number of animals and merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 65 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en una casa de material rústico, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Segundo se dedica a labores agrícolas cultivando café, con 10 años en el negocio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abonos y para mantenimiento de su finca, con esto el obtendrá mayores rendimientos, mejorará su producción de café, lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 65 years old.  He lives with his spouse in a rustic house in the Pucará district of the Jaén province in the Catamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.  The people of this district work in agriculture, livestock and business.  Segundo works in agriculture, growing coffee.  He has worked doing this for 10 years.  He has great personal and professional references in the area.

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and to perform maintenance on his farm.  With this, he will improve his yield and his coffee production, which will allow him to increase his earnings and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and perform maintenance on his farm.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and married with five children.  Norma is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. 

Norma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her chickens.  Norma has been raising chickens for 15 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora is 66 years old and married with four children.  Pastora is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Pastora requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Pastora has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Pastora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia works hard to support her family. Sylvia is married and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Sylvia requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen food to sell.

Sylvia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional used clothing to sell in her used clothing business.

Elsa has been in this business for 23 years. Elsa earns more income from direct selling Avon and personal collection products.  She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional  used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 44 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Juliet has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: Immacule est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Maombi», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un maçon, âgée de 39 ans, mère 2 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissions frais  au marché de la ville depuis 14 ans. Elle va acheter 150 poissons frais. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Immacule is a merchant, president of the  "Maombi" loan group and a client of the Hekima MFI.

She is married to a mason, and at age 39 is the mother of two children who attend school. She started her business with funds received from her husband.

She has been selling fresh fish in the city's market for the past 14 years, and wants to buy 150 fresh fish. She wishes to increase her turnover, and see to her children's education and nourishment.

In the end she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 150 fresh fish

loans.name: Dúo Mercado Ll Group

texts.es:
DUO MERCADO II
El cual esta conformado por la señora Flor de María quien es propietaria  de una venta de juegos pedagógicos y madre de una niña la cual aun esta de meses de nacida ya tiene algunos años de dedicarse a la venta de los mismos durante la semana se dedica a vender en la universidad y a la venta de bisuterías  y en esta ocasión ella toca las puertas de FAPE para la adquisición de un crédito el  cual ella desea invertirlo para la compra de materiales nuevos y modernizados en el área de matemática por lo que de antemano agradece que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud…
texts.en:
Flor de Maria forms half of the group 'Duo Mercado II' which sells educational games.  

She is the mother of a young girl who is still a baby.  

She has been selling these products for several years.  During the week, she sells at the university.  She also sells costume jewelry.  

She has come to FAPE to ask for a loan to buy new, up-to-date material related to mathematics.  

She is very grateful for any help that the lenders can give.

loans.use: to buy educational material to sell.

loans.name: Sharon Mae

texts.en:
Sharon Mae is a married woman. She is 37 years old with three children, ages between nine and 14.  

Sharon Mae relies on her sari-sari store and tricycle businesses to provide for her family. Her husband is the one who drives their tricycle to help with the expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for her store, such as cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee, and biscuits. She will also use the money to repair their side car. 

Sharon dreams of being successful in sending her children to school and for them to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee, and biscuits.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is from Ilagan City, Isabela. She is married and blessed with two children. Her husband works as a laborer while she manages their sari-sari store. Though both of them are earning, it is sometimes not enough for all their expenses, especially since they are sending their son, Cliford Jay, to college. That’s why they want to seek a PHP 150,000 financial assistance loan from Kiva lenders. Cliford is taking up a BS in Secondary Education. He wants to finish college to improve his family’s way of living.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben is a tricyle driver within his village and nearby communities. He is single and 37 years of age. He is now asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to use in repairing his vehicle. He will also buy gasoline to use in his transport service. He hopes to continuously provide safe travel to all his passengers and to earn good income to use for his family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle trouble and buy gasoline to use in his transport business

loans.name: Mikhael

texts.en: Mikhael is a 27-year-old single man. He is the second child of four siblings. Three of them are married. Mikhael now is in the last semester of his study in teacher college. In addition to being a student he also works as an ojek (a motorcycle taxi driver) to pay his education fees and to sell mobile phone credit charger. Currently he needs more cash to pay the registration fees but he does not have much money to do so. Therefore he has applied for an individual loan of IDR 4,000,000 to TLM. The loan will be spent on the registration fees and to restock more credit charger. He hopes that his business will be running well and so enable him to repay the installment of the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for his college and to restock more credit for his business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is grateful that she was previously granted a 55,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed to sell in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

Marilou would now like to apply for a 60,000 PHP loan which she will use as working capital to purchase large quantities of grocery items such as rice, pasta, beverages, rice noodles, and other groceries which she retails in her store. She expects a higher demand of groceries this holiday season. Her income from her store is a stable source which covers both her family's basic needs and the education costs of her children. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas! 

Marilou dreams expanding her mini-general store into a big grocery store someday.
