She aims to give her children the best education so they can have better opportunities to improve their quality of life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed to sell in her general store business.

loans.name: Avecenia

texts.en:
Avecenia is grateful that she was granted a PHP 30,000 loan which she used to purchase computer parts and accessories needed for her internet cafe. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their basic daily needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 which she will use to pay for the maintenance of her computers and partly to pay for ready-to-wear clothes to sell.Avecenia is positive that she will have good returns on her investment.

Avecenia aims to have more branches for her internet cafe and to attract more customers to her ready-to-wear clothes shop. She also desires to share her blessings with her less fortunate relatives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 39 years old and has four children. Rosana is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Rosana is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosana has been 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel works hard to support her family. Lizel is married and has a selling seafoods business in the Philippines.

Lizel requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF.

Lizel has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seafoods to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Judith is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle rickshaw for her bicycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle rickshaw for her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 58-year-old, married woman with eight children. Lilia works very hard to provide for her family.

Lilia runs a personal products business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as perfume, lotion, etc.

Lilia has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as perfume, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Angilyn

texts.en:
Angilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell veterinary products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of feeds, rice barns and other veterinary products for her buy and sell veterinary products business.

Angilyn has been in this business for three years. Angilyn earns more income from farming rice and buy and sell charcoal.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Angilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding  her business to secure the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of feeds, rice barns and other veterinary products for her buy and sell

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 57 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a soft-drinks "buy and sell" in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional soft drinks to sell.

Ruby has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the soft-drinks "buy and sell" for 15 years and also earns an income farming rice and save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

In the future she would save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Susan has been in this business for 22 years now. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

In the future, Susan would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Juvy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store.  

Juvy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by selling food business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store businesses. Ruth is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to ingredients for her food business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 57 years old and married with four children.

Leonarda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Leonarda has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending and tailoring.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonarda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jovelin

texts.en:
Jovelin is a 34-year-old married with two children who works hard to provide for her family. 

She has run a general store for 4 years and requests 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, spices, noodles, eggs, and sugar.

Jovelin has borrowed and repaid 10 previous loans. She earns additional income as a food vendor.

She successfully repaid the previous loan and requests another loan to further build the businesses.

She aspires to save enough money to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy  shampoo, spices, noodles, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Şengül

texts.en:
Şengül is the mother of three children. To help her husband pay their school expenses she makes baked goods at home to sell. She sells savory pastries and stuffed rolls to a cafe as well as taking orders for birthdays and other celebrations. She is happy with her job. Her dream is for her children to finish university. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Ebru Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Çocukların okul masrafını karşılamak eşine destek olmak için evde yapıp sattığı hamur işlerine devam ediyor.  Kafeye su böreği ve poğaça satışını yanında, doğum günü ,özel günlere de sipariş üzerine çalışıyor.  Yaptığı işten memnun .  Hayali çocuklarının üniversiteyi bitirdiğini görmek.

loans.use: to buy more pastry ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Muath

texts.en: Muath is a 24-year-old single man. He lives with his family in Jarash. Muath is now in his second year, majoring in Electrical Wiring Engineering. To be able to afford his school fees and buy the needed books every semester, Muath works as an assistant baker. He works in the morning, goes to the university, and then comes back in the afternoon to complete his shift . Now Muath is short on money to pay for his next semester fees, so he requested an education loan to help him pay the university.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa, de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera de 1 niño, su pareja la abandono. 

Rosa, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, ella se levanta a las 6:00 a.m. para abrir su tienda y prepararse para ir a las parcelas donde cultiva.


Rosa, se dedica también a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que le he enseño su ex pareja.- Durante la mañana trabaja sembrando granos básicos, mientras su madre cuida en la tienda y en el transcurso de la tarde, ella retoma las actividades de la tienda. 

Rosa, necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas para la siembra (semilla, abono, veneno y para pagar mano de obra, ella espera obtener una buena producción para el sustento de su familia.

Rosa, desea en un futuro ampliar su tienda, comprar nuevos productos y colocar un molino para maíz ya que donde reside no hay uno cerca.
texts.en:
Rosa, 23, studied until ninth grade.  She has one child and is a single mother after her partner left her.  She has a small store in her house.  She gets up at 6:00 am to open and then she gets ready to go to the plots of land where she grows her crops.  This is another line of work she is involved in; skills that she learnt from her ex-partner.  

In the morning she sows basic grains while her mother looks after the store.  During the afternoon, Rosa takes over from her mother and runs the store.  

She needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies for sowing her crops (seeds, manure, insecticide) and also to pay for labor costs.  

She hopes to have a good harvest so she can provide for her family.  

In the future she would like to expand her store and buy new products.  One such example would be a mill for grinding corn as there is not one available in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her crops and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a washing machine for the house.

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
Merry is a 38-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Merry has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years and she also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories, for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Merry has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. 

For this financial assistance, Merry is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, a hair brush, and other accessories, for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to vigorously expand sales of  drinking water filter in Borneo, Indonesia

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en: Nagina is 46 years of age. She is a married lady with three children. She is been in work of machine embroidery and her experience of many years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her children. For the improvement of her business she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and needles in large quantities. This will help her to meet orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and needles in large quantities to meet orders on time.

loans.name: Zeeshan

texts.en:
Zeeshan is a young and enthusiastic entrepreneur who runs a mini factory for paint brushes in Karachi. He is 28 years old and lives with his family. He is obedient and hardworking.

He is gaining more experience with time and is constantly striving to improve his business. He wishes to purchase raw materials for making paint brushes in his factory, so he has decided to request a small enterprise program loan from BRAC Pakistan to get more established and improve his living standards.

Though his business is not yet self-sufficient, he is hopeful that with his hard work and motivation he will make it profitable and sustainable. He wants to hire more labor in the future to distribute the work load and also expand. 

This loan will help him buy raw materials for making paint brushes. Zeeshan is very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making paint brushes

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom’s group live in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sokhom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en:
Mrs. Kartini sells Nazava Water Filters in Surabaya a large city in the East of Java. In Surabaya you cannot drink the water from the tap and well water, on which over 50 % of the population relies is of poor quality. Therefore, she is selling water filters so that people can filter their own well, tap or rainwater and purify it so they can drink it without the need for boiling. 
Mrs. Kartini knew about the business from her daughter, who helped her also with the initial capital required.  Mrs. Kartini is very upbeat about the prospects and wants to use here loan to be able to sell more filters starting in her neighborhood. 
With the requested loan, Mrs. Kartini can provide safe drinking water to about 70 families.

loans.use: To provide safe drinking waters to inhabitants of Surabaya, Indonesia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the conversion of the basement to meet the Health Ministry standards and to purchase machinery for peeling and dicing the vegetables

loans.name: Enorina

texts.es: ENORINA: Es una  maestra originaria de Waspam,  tiene 46 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos adolescentes que están estudiando su primaria. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco, desde hace tres años ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de madera, pero con sus propios esfuerzos no ha podido completar. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para completar el  techo. Con el préstamo va comprar madera, zinc liso, zinc, clavos y pagar la mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita de cemento, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y ambiente para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Enorina, 46, is a teacher from Waspam.  She is the single mother of three young children who are in primary school.  

Thanks to a lot of hard work, she has been able to build her wooden house little by little.  However, she has not been able to finish it yet as her own funds do not cover it.  

That is why she is asking for a loan so she can finish the roof.  She will use the loan to buy wood, galvanized sheets, zinc, nails and pay for labor costs.  

She dreams of having a nice house made of bricks, with better security for herself and her family.

loans.use: to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Excel School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jenipher. She is the Head teacher of Excel Infant School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Kyebando with 92 students. Excel Infant School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Excel Infant School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jenipher ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tauch's Group

texts.en: Tauch’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Tauch makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Maurice's Group

texts.en:
Maurice is 41 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Kitanda D village in Kenya. Maurice works as a business owner for a living. His community of Kitanda D village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Maurice is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by his village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Maurice represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Maurice and 2 other promoters in his community, namely Beverlyne and Grace, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Maurice wants to be a promoter because he believes that the chlorine will kill bacteria in water making it safe for drinking, thus alleviating water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Maurice’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Meteda

texts.en:
Mr. Meteda is an inspirational salesperson who lives on the Northern shore of Papua. Papua is the most remote part of Indonesia and has been the scene of a long lasting armed unrest. Potable water is difficult to get in here and for that reason, Meteda is trading Nazava water filters that make dirty well and rain safe to drink.
By marketing Nazava Water Filters Meteda makes a supplementary 110 dollar per month while at one go providing access to safe drinking water.
Newcomers from other parts of Indonesia undertake the best part of commerce in Papua. Meteda, who is a indigenous Papuan considers it his calling to demonstrate his brother Papuans that people that come from Papua can become effective entrepreneurs as well.  Meteda is selling Nazava Water Filters six days a week at markets around his town
Next, Meteda desires to sell in a wider geographical area and also try to sell the filters at offices of the local administration and the offices of local companies. 
Meteda will use this loan to buy more Nazava water filters on credit. Because Meteda, lives more than 3000 kilometres away from the Nazava warehouse it is very important to have enough stock.

loans.use: To provide more people with access to save drinking water in Papua, Indonesia

loans.name: Maria Thereza School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Makanga. He is the Head Teacher of Maria Thereza Ledochowska Secondary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Lugazi in Buikwe with 150 students. Maria Thereza Ledochowska Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 5 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Maria Thereza Ledochowska Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Makanga ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source at their home.

Greetings from Uganda! This is Peter. He is the Head teacher of Lugazi Progressive College, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Lugazi in Buikwe with 500 students. Lugazi Progressive College has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Buikwe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Hassan. He is the Head Teacher of Buikwe High School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Buikwe with 150 students. Buikwe High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 10 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Buikwe High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Hassan ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: St. Mary's College Lugazi School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Moses. He is the Head teacher of St Mary’s College Lugazi, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Lugazi with 1520 students. St Mary’s College has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St Mary’s College will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Moses ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: A Ga Lone Village Group

texts.en: This community is located in A Ga Lone Village in Myanmar's Delta region. The Community Based Organization consists of five committee members overseeing 25 village customers.This new loan would help the A Ga Lone Village group members buy food for ducks (1 packet= $13, a week's feed for 100 ducks) and purchase more ducks. More ducks means extra income per month. Most of the villagers are farmers who specialize in crops and some as well have livestock such as pigs, hens and cows. Young boys in the village earn from cycle or car carries. Pictured above are committee members from A Ga Lone Village's CBO named Daw Kay, Daw Mi, U Myint, U Tin, and U Tun. Included in the photo, Daw Kay (first from left), is 31 years old. She is a housewife and also helps her husband on the crop farm. She lives together with four family members including her two sons. Apart from cropping, she plants betel nuts too and for extra income she raises pigs and ducks as livestock. Like the other members, she plans to buy more food for her ducks and expand the number of ducks.

loans.use: expand their number of ducks as well as buy good quality feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Ka Mar Par Village Group

texts.en: This community is located in Ka Mar Par Village Myanmar's Ayeyearwaddy Delta region. The Community Based Organization (CBO) consists of five committee members overseeing 16 village customers. This new loan would help the Ka Mar Par Village group members buy food for ducks (1 packet = $13, one week's feed for 100 ducks) and purchase more ducks. More ducks would let them have extra income. Pictured above are committee members from Ka Mar Par Village CBO named Daw San, Daw Thawe, U Aung, Daw Than, and U Aung. Even though most villagers are farmers, they as well raise ducks, pigs, and cows for livestock. In addition, they plant seasonal vegetables to have extra income.  For the education in the village, they have up to 5th grade and for upper studies, students have to go to town or other villages. Included in photo, Daw San (second from right), is a farmer. She is married and her husband as well is a farmer. She lives together with four children who are all students. She mostly does cropping and plants seasonal foods by renting someone else's farm. Like the other fellows who are taking this loan, she will purchase more ducks as well as good quality feed.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks as well as good quality feed.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una de ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y con su lucha diaria está mejorando sus vidas.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Mirna, quien es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere ayudar a su familia, y es por ello que cada día lucha y pone todo de sí. Ella es comerciante, y se dedica a las ventas varias, con lo que tiene los medios para ayudar a sus seres queridos. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para la venta, como ser aceite, jabones, suavizantes y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Emprendedoras" is in its 3rd loan cycle with the Committee of Women program.  Each of these women is continuing with her daily struggle to improve her life through her efforts and hard work.

One of these women is Mirna, who is a very self-sacrificing woman who wants to help her family.  This is why she strives each day and puts everything of herself into her work.  She is a merchant who sells a variety of products.  With her earnings, she is able to help her loved ones.

Mirna is requesting this loan to invest in products to sell, such as cooking oil, soaps, fabric softeners, and other items.  This way she can continue with her sales, as she has been doing.  She appreciates the opportunity that she is receiving to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy products to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 18 años y 16 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida  y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Silvia desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda dado que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado y desea aprovechar este tiempo que no hay lluvias para repararlo. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en:
Silvia is 37 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children, ages 18 and 16. She has for many years sold clothing for a living, and together with her husband, supports their household. 

Silvia wants to install a new roof on her home as the existing one has deteriorated over time. She'd hopes to take advantage of the dry season for these repairs. Silvia will use the funds form the loan she's requested to purchase galvanized sheeting and wood.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting and wood for repairs to the roof of her home.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 63 años de edad, es separado, vive con su hija en casa propia en la zona rural del anexo La Aviación del distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de caña y arroz, ganadería y comercio.

Daniel se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como borregos, pavos, gallinas y cerdos, con más de 16 años de antigüedad en el negocio, el cual está ubicado en su propio domicilio. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de alimento de engorde para sus animales y para ampliar sus corrales. De esta manera logrará hacer crecer su negocio, mejorará su producción y obtendrá más ingresos, con lo que podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel is 63 years old, separated, and lives with his daughter in his own house in a rural zone in the La Aviación annex to Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. The population in the district works in agriculture, primarily cultivating sugar cane and rice, animal husbandry, and trade. 

Daniel works raising and selling animals such as sheep, turkeys, hens, and pigs, with more than 16 years in the business, which is located at his own home. The loan will be used to purchase fattening food for his animals and to expand their corrals. In this way, he will manage to grow his business, improve his production, and get more income, with which he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fattening food for his animals and to expand their corrals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for her degree/diploma for her professional career.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent agricultural land.

loans.name: Blanca Esther

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en la zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Blanca se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como pavos, gallinas, patos, cuyes, etc. con 06 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como patos, gallina, cuyes, etc. y compra de alimento de engorde para estos. Esto le ayudará a tener una mayor producción en su negocio, satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes, con lo que logrará incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is 31 years old, is married, and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children in the rural zone of Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. The population in the district works in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade.

Blanca works raising and selling small animals such as turkeys, hens, ducks, guinea pigs, etc. with 6 years of experience in the business, which is located in her home. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of animals such as ducks, hens, guinea pigs, etc. and purchase fattening food for them. This will help her to have more production in her business, satisfying her customers' needs, with which she will manage to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger number of animals such as ducks, hens, guinea pigs, etc. and purchase fattening food for them.

loans.name: Salvina

texts.en:
Salvina, a 62-year-old married mother of three, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 10 years now. A recipient of four previous loans from NWTF, she is requesting a new one for PHP 10000 to purchase vaccines, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Salvina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Glendel

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Ma. Glendel works hard to support her family.

She has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Ma. Glendel is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle for her vehicle transport business.

Ma. Glendel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 42 years old with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, spices, coffee, noodles, etc.

Marivel has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from farming rice and raising livestock.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, spices, coffee and noodles

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
Sheena is 19 years old and married. 

Sheena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sheena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sheena has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Sheena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga works hard to support her family. Dominga is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Dominga requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Dominga has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Dominga would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janet is 29 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Janet has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.  Janet has been in this business for 14 years. 

Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane is 41 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Jeane works very hard to provide for them.

Jeane runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries and other items like coffee, vinegar, toothpaste, canned goods, snack foods, beers, candies, etc. to sell.  Jeane has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items such as coffee, vinegar, toothpaste, canned goods, snack foods, beers, candies, etc. 

In the future, Jeane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and other items like coffee, vinegar, toothpaste, canned goods, snack foods, beers, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Murat

texts.en:
This is Murat, a 52-year-old villager who has been photographed with his horse. The money that he is requesting from you will be used to pay for the engagement events of his son. Kindly note that in rural Albania events such as engagements and weddings are part of the tradition that someone can’t avoid. And not only that, but parents have to pay for the expenses as well.

Murat has two children, aged 25 and 22, and he does agriculture for a living, planting and selling largely wheat and beans. His 25-year-old son who is about to get engaged, works in a nearby gas station. The village is situated near the Greek border; in 1910 immigrants from Rumania settled there, who still practice their own traditions and language.

loans.use: to pay for his son's engagement event.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres  Nueva Estrella  se formo en la ciudad de Lambaré, gracias al esfuerzo de cada una y la ayuda que se brindan las unas a las otras, ya están en su ciclo 8 del programa de comité de mujeres.
Cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo, pero se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Elisa, quien vende ricas hamburguesas y otros comestibles, ella es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que ya se pudo formar un muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella lo que vende. Poco a poco se abrió camino y hoy la es una microempresaria.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de panes, hamburguesas, verduras, condimentos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas. Elisa agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo que le permitirá mejorar su condición de vida
texts.en: The "Nueva Estrella" Women's Group was formed in the city of Lambaré thanks to each of these women's efforts and the help they give each other. They are already in their 8th loan cycle of the program of the Women's Group. Each of them puts her best effort, but one who stands out is Elisa who sells hamburgers and other food. She is very good at what she does, and because of it she was able to get many customers who always buy what she sells. Little by little she moved ahead, and now she is a small businesswoman. She is requesting this loan to buy bread, hamburgers, vegetables, spices, and other things, and in this way be able to continue with her sales. Elisa is grateful for the help she is receiving which will allow her to improve her life situation.

loans.use: to buy bread, hamburgers, vegetables, spices and other things.

loans.name: Celina Morena

texts.es: Celina tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 14 años y 11 años de edad. Celina se gana la vida por medio de la venta de granos básicos como: maíz y frijoles. Gracias a este negocio puede llevar el sustento a su hogar  y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen el equilibrio económico de su hogar. Ella desea reparar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizad  y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Celina is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their 3 children aged 17, 14, and 11.  Celina earns a living by selling staple grains such as corn and beans.  Thanks to this business, she can help support her household, and together with her life partner they can maintain their household in financial equilibrium.    

Celina wants to repair the roof of her house, and so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheets of corrugated metal and wood to make the repairs on her roof.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her roof

loans.name: Lusungu Group

texts.en:
ASIA, who is in her late forties, is married with four grown-up kids.  For four years now, she has been running several projects. She sells small dry fish called dagga, she runs a genge business and she also sells chips.  She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be ASIA's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her products and has paid back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan and thanks Kiva for its support.  She used the profit to take care of herself, pay back the loan and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase stocks of small dry fish stock, to restock the out of stock items in the genge and to buy Irish potatoes and cooking oil for making chips.  She dreams of building another shop and owning a car.

ASIA will share this loan with her loan group, "LUSUNGU," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stocks of small dry fish stock, to restock the out of stock items in the genge and to buy Irish potatoes and cooking oil for making chips

loans.name: Raquel Zara

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 54 años soltera, con dos hijas ya señoritas que aún están cursando sus estudios superiores. Ella tiene su propia bodega en un pequeño espacio de su casa, hace tres años que se dedica a este negocio, con el ingreso de estas ventas solventa los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de sus dos hijas. El sueño de Raquel es ver que sus hijas se realicen profesionalmente. Raquel solicitó el crédito para comprar mercaderías para su bodega.
Raquel se siente muy contenta por el apoyo recibido de los inversionistas Kiva
texts.en:
Raquel, 54, is single and has two grown-up daughters who are still studying in higher education.  

She has her own store which she runs from a small space in her home.  She has been doing this for nearly three years. 

With the profits she makes, she can take care of the household expenses and pay for her daughters' studies.  

She dreams of seeing her children become working professionals.  

She is asking for this loan to buy stock for her store.  She is very satisfied with the help and support she receives from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Yvoty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Yvoty, está formado por 17  integrantes, todas están  en el ciclo 11 del programa de comité de mujeres .Se encuentran además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Daniela, quien en la encuesta que se le practicó esta en el nivel 3, es decir que ha superado su pobreza extrema a través del esfuerzo y por medio de  la mercería que tiene. Comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano y que siempre recibe la ayuda de su hija.
La Sra. Daniela pide este préstamo para la compra de artículos varios de mercería para la venta, como ser termos, ollas, prendas, calzados, zapatillas y demás, ya que con ello podrá surtirse y seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes todo lo que buscan. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo y luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "Yvoty" consists of 17 members. All are in their 11th loan cycle in the women's committee program. They are also in the program to eliminate poverty, striving every day to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the members is Señora Daniela, who in the survey that was performed was in level 3, that is to say, she has overcome her extreme poverty through her effort and by means of the notions store that she has. She comments that every day she begins work very early and that she always receives help from her daughter.

Señora Daniela is requesting this loan to purchase various notions to sell, such as thermoses, pots, articles of clothing, footwear, slippers, and other items, since with it she will be able to stock her store and continue offering her customers everything that they look for. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue with her work and striving for her family.

loans.use: to buy thermos bottles, pots, articles of clothing, footwear, slippers, and other items for sale.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is a resident of Estancia, Iloilo. She is forty years old and has four children aged between four and seventeen.  Elvie started a business selling dried fish and frozen meat products fifteen years ago. This business has been thriving since then. But since Elvie also support her children in their education, she needs more capital to make the business sustainable. She is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy sausages, hot dogs, longganisa (Filipino sausage) and dried fish to sell. Elvie’s priority is spending her profit on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy sausages, hot dogs, longganisa (Filipino sausage) and dried fish

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a forty-seven-year-old man from the town of Estancia, Iloilo. He is married and has two dependents aged six and eighteen. Noel is engaged in hog raising and a fish culturing business that he runs out of his fish pond. Noel is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy African cat fish, cichlid fish and feed for the hogs. 

Once these needs are taken care of, Noel will be able to make concentrate on his efforts to manage his business well, so he can improve his return on investment.

Noel plans to expand his business someday.

loans.use: to buy African catfish, cichlid fish and hog feed

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en: Muhayo is married and has a child. She is the kind of person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to her family. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, so, Muhayo is the main breadwinner of her family. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry three years ago. She is developing her business little by little.  Muhayo requested a loan in the amount of 5,200 Somoni to increase the number of cattle she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de arroz, yuca, maíz y al comercio de animales menores.

Maria Elena se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como patos, pavos, cuyes, etc. con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio. Su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y para el mejoramiento de la infraestructura donde se encuentran estos, con esto Maria Elena tendrá un mayor stock de animales y mejores condiciones para la crianza de los mismos, lo que tendrá gran influencia en el negocio. Maria Elena espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo cual le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Elena is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. The population in the district works in agriculture, primarily cultivating rice, yucca, and corn, and in selling small animals. 

María Elena works raising and selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, etc. with more than 10 years of experience in the business. Her business is located at her home. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of animals and to improve the structure where they are kept. With this, María Elena will have a better stock of animals and improved conditions to raise them, which will have a big impact on her business. María Elena hopes to improve her business's production to be able to meet the diverse needs and preferences of customers in the zone, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger number of animals and improve the structure where they are kept.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn lives in Ozamiz City and supports her three children by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and availed another loan one to buy building material, paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paints, pay her workers.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic commodities like bread, sugar, noodles, toothpaste, eggs, cooking oil and bath soap. He is forty-three years old, married and has five kids. His oldest child is twelve and the youngest is eight.  In addition to that, he also owns a bakery. He sells bread, pastries and other delicacies.

Edwin  has requested  for a loan to buy additional stocks for the store and bakery supplies.  These ingredients will be used in making bread, which he will sell in his local community. The loan will also be used to fill his store with a wider variety of stock, so that he can attract more buyers. In the long run, Edwin will gain higher earnings, so that he can provide his family with good food and better living conditions.

In the future, Edwin hopes to expand his business to make it productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store and bakery supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell at her mini store.

loans.name: Melanimfa

texts.en:
Melanimfa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Melanimfa has been in this business for eleven years. Melanimfa earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melanimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Mayomerdescora

texts.en:
Mayomerdescora is 38 years old, and has four children. Mayomerdescora is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Mayomerdescora is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mayomerdescora requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Mayomerdescora has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mayomerdescora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 38 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Noemi has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Noemi aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 43 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Noralyn has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal for five years and earns additional income from farming rice and raising livestock.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Melanie Abas

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 64 years old, and married with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Melania requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Melania has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Melania would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa works hard to support her family. Ninfa is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tailoring materials for her business.

Ninfa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ninfa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring materials for her business

loans.name: Gala

texts.en:
Gala is a 73-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gala has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gala requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell.

Gala has been in this business for 16 years.  In the future, Gala would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. Annabelle is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, shrimp, spices, etc.  Annabelle has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, shrimp, spices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pass a medical examination and find out the reason for her unfamiliar feelings

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with five children; two children are still in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for her family.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 5 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 54 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Elsie has been running the general store for 29 years and also earns an income from food vending. She has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira, a 34-year-old married mother of two, adores her family. Her husband works very hard so that they can have a good and respectable life. He owns a clothing-sales business which is the family's only source of income. 

Because her husband needs additional capital for the growth of his business, Sumaira is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to enable him to purchase a variety of clothes so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He will put aside some of his profits to pay the electricity and gas bills. 

Sumaira hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Sipha

texts.en: Mrs. Sipha, 29, lives in Kratie Province with her husband, Heng. They have two children: Mr Kim(20) is a student and Haiy, 14, is also a student. She and her husband are Home Made Noodle cooker they make Khmer Noodle to sell to wholesalers at Kratie Market and some in the village. They use battery to supply electricity in their home and business. She spend a lot on them and it's unhealthy. They want to use solar system for a better living condition.

loans.use: To buy solar system

location.town: Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr Borei

loans.name: Nurgiza

texts.en:
Nurgiza is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Sociology. Here is her story:

“I applied for the Sociology Program. I believe that my profession will enable me to fulfill all my desires to help others, to continuously expand my knowledge base and skills. All my life I have participated in extracurricular activities at school including volunteering. I have striven for academic excellence, always wishing to make the most of my school education.
 
Last year I finished the one-year program of New Generation Academy of AUCA. I was one of the 70 winners of a full Scholarship for this Program. Thanks to this Program I became stronger morally, purposeful, and it gave me a chance to enter AUCA. Also I was awarded a Best Effort Award for my academic excellence at NGA. 

My family made many sacrifices to allow me to focus on my studies. Now I have an opportunity to become the first person in my family to attend university, though I am in need of financial aid. I have five siblings and I am the eldest one; the others study at school or go to kindergarten. My parents hadn’t conditions to have a higher education and were forced to do always physical work. They grow vegetables and beans in the field and sell them at the local markets. So my family’s income is unstable and depends on weather conditions. Recently my mother gave a birth to my youngest sibling and stays at home.
 
Applying for a Kiva loan, I ask for help not only for me but also for my family, as we are one unit, and its future depends on each member of it. Getting a degree means for me changing the future of me, my parents and my siblings.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Emeriana

texts.en:
A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Emeriana introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community.
 
Emeriana is a teacher in a remote area of Central Kalimantan (previously known as Borneo). She travels by small boat cruising the longest river in the island to reach her students. Her village, Tumbang Malawan, is not covered by electricity. Even though the government has distributed solar home lighting systems to some households in the area, they still require portable solar lamps to check their farm at night and do other activities after the sun goes down.
 
To increase her income, Emeriana has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell solar lights and water filters. She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her business. 

Emeriana believes that when she sells the technologies, she is bringing positive improvements to the people she sells to. Now, her students can have a proper lighting to assist their night time study instead of depending on toxic kerosene lanterns. She will also sell water filters that can save time and money from boiling the water.

loans.use: A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Emeriana introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community.

loans.name: April Boy

texts.en: April Boy is a 19-year old vocational graduate and lives in Bago City. He belongs to a family of 9. His father is working for the local government of Bago City as a driver, and his mother is a housewife. April Boy has 6 siblings. His eldest and 3rd brother work for the same local government, while his sisters are still in school. Their total monthly family income of Php 10,000.00 ($227) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates April Boy to find means to help the family have more income that's why he braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping his family, April Boy also dreams of finishing his studies and of sending his other siblings to school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to busy home solar system

loans.name: Theany

texts.en: Mrs. Theany, 22, lives in Buk Toek Village in Cambodia with her husband, Mr. Pheng. They do not have any children yet. She is a Vendor. She sells groceries with her husband to wholesalers in her commune.  They use battery and generator to supply their home electricity which is very expensive, unhealthy and not good for the environment so she chooses solar system to supply their home electricity and to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy solar system

location.town: Buk Toek Village, Preaek Brasab Commune, Preaek Br

loans.name: Phanney

texts.en: Phanney(29) lives in Kratie Province with her husband, Tola and three children. She and her husband are Vendors. They buy cassavas, mangos and soya bean and resell to wholesalers. They also grow rubber. They use battery and generator to supply home electricity. It's very expensive and unhealthy. They do not want to waste their time and money so they decide to choose solar system to supply electricity for their home and to improve their living condition.

loans.use: To pay for home solar system

location.town: Buk Toek Village, Preaek Brasab Commune, Preaek Br

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Encarnación, con mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, están en el 5º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María,  ella  es cliente de la Fundación hace varios años, se desempeña como directora e integrante de este grupo, tiene un almacén en su casa que con esfuerzo pudo montar y que hoy es el sostén de su familia. Ella pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con todo tipo de productos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
Desea comprar lácteos, panificados, verduras, frutas y demás, de manera a seguir con su microempresa, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Kuña Aty is a group formed in the city of Encarnación, with very hard-working and determined women. They are in their 5th loan cycle in the program of women's committees where they all work and help each other to get ahead, in addition they are part of the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is María. She has been a client of the Fundación for a number of years. She serves as director and member of this group. She has a store in her house that, with effort, she was able to open and today it sustains her family. She asks for this loan to be able to stock her business with all sorts of products, so as to be able to continue with her sales.

She wants to purchase dairy products, bakery goods, vegetables, fruits, and others to continue with her micro-enterprise, fighting to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, bakery goods, vegetables, fruits, and others to continue with her sales.

loans.name: Marìa Gioconda

texts.es:
Marìa es una señora casada, con un hijo a su cargo de profesion Secretaria de la cual tiene 27 años de laborar con la que ha formado a sus  hijos profesionalmente.
Actualmente esta señora visito la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para la contruccion de un garaje en su vivienda y lo invertiria en la compra de materiales de construccion tales como  cemento. piedrin, arena  y pago  de mano de obra , el que le vendria a dar mejores condiciones  en su vivienda
texts.en:
María is a married, mother of one child, who is in her care. She's been a professional secretary for 27 years.

Actually, this woman visited the Ceprodel community bank to request a loan in order to build a garage for her home; she'll invest in construction materials, like cement, stones, sand and manual labour in order to improve the conditions of her home.

loans.use: build a garage for her home; she'll buy cement, stone and sand, and pay manual labour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Máxima de 56 años de edad se gana la vida desde hace 30 años elaborando las deliciosas pupusas que tanto gustan a sus clientes que gracias a sus buenos precios y amabilidad cada día son más. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su 3 hijos de 23, 17 y 8 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante sola después de perder a su esposo. Máxima desea invertir en materiales para poder cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, queso, frijoles, repollo, tomates, aceite, harina de arroz, maíz, etc.
texts.en:
Máxima, who is 56 years old, has earned a living for 30 years preparing the delicious pupusas [filled tortillas] that are so much liked by her customers, who, thanks to her good prices and friendliness, are more every day. She lives in her own house along with her three children, ages 23, 17, and 8, whom she has managed to raise alone after losing her husband. 

Máxima wants to invest in supplies to be able to meet the demand for the products that her customers seek, and for that she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in pork rinds, cheese, beans, cabbage, tomatoes, oil, rice flour, corn, etc.

loans.use: to invest in pork rinds, cheese, beans, cabbage, tomatoes, oil, rice flour, corn, etc.

loans.name: Ruben Anderson

texts.es: Rubén de 32 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida con su esfuerzo, por lo que actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas de temporada las cuales vende de forma ambulante en su vehículo que es su mayor apoyo, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace dos años y que le ha permitido sostener a su familia. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 1 y 6 años de edad. Rubén desea invertir en naranjas y piñas ya que son las que en esta temporada tiene mayor demanda y mejor precio y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en naranjas y piñas por mayor para vender en su vehículo y así obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Rubén is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their two children, ages 1 and 6, in the family's own home. He is an industrious man who learned from a very early age to earn a living through hard work. Rubén now works buying and selling seasonal fruit, making sales from a truck, which is his most valuable business asset. Rubén went into the fruit business two years ago, and it's allowed him to support his family. 

Rubén wants to invest in the purchase of oranges and pineapples, which generate higher demand this time of year, as well as higher prices. Rubén is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI for the wholesale purchase of oranges and pineapples, which he'll sell from his truck and earn a good income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale oranges.

loans.name: Elsa Cleotilde

texts.es: Elsa de 64 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 32 años y su hijo de 25 años de edad que le apoyan con los gastos económicos de su vivienda. Ella se gana la vida con su negocio de compra y venta de cerdos, además elabora y vende deliciosos tamales de gallina que distribuye de forma ambulante por los cantones cercanos desde hace 30 años por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre esperan por sus productos. Elsa desea tener una mayor liquidez económica para invertir en cerdos y los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de sus tamales ya que no logra cumplir con la demanda de productos con la que cuenta por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cerdos y materiales necesarios para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en: Elsa, 64 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter, 32 years old, and son, 25 years old, who help her with the economic expenses of her house. She earns her living with her business buying and selling pigs, and in addition she makes and sells delicious chicken tamales which she has sold as a street vendor through the nearby cantons for 30 years, so she has a large number of customers who always wait for her products. Elsa wants to have more economic liquidity to invest in pigs and the materials needed to make her tamales, since she doesn't manage to fill the demand for the products with what she has, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in pigs and materials necessary to make tamales.

loans.use: to invest in pigs and materials needed to make tamales.

loans.name: Ivan Bladimiro

texts.es: Iván de 63 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que desde joven aprendió de sus padres a ganarse la vida con su esfuerzo y dedicación, por lo que actualmente se dedica a vender helados de forma ambulante en su improvisado carretón elaborado por el mismo, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años por lo que es muy reconocido en los cantones que visita con su venta. Él habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 23 años de edad que apoya con los gastos del hogar a su padre. Iván desea realizar una mayor inversión en su negocio ya que cuenta con una demanda de productos que no logra cubrir por la falta de liquidez económica con la que cuenta por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en helados y paletas por mayoreo.
texts.en:
Iván, 63 years old, is a hard-working man who, since he was young, learned from his parents to earn his living with his efforts and hard work. So, he currently works selling ice cream as a street vendor in his improvised cart that he made. He has done this work for 20 years, so he is very well-known in the cantons that he visits with his sales. 

He lives in his own house with his wife and their 23-year-old son who helps with the household expenses of his father's home. Iván wants to make a bigger investment in his business since he has demand for products which he isn't able to meet due to lack of economic liquidity, so he counts on asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in ice creams and popsicles in bulk.

loans.use: to invest in ice creams and popsicles in bulk.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 65 years old and married with two children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for 19 years.

In the future, Merlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Levita

texts.en:
Levita works hard to support her family. Levita is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Levita has been in this business for three years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Levita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in the village Achajur in Tavush region. Narine has a vocational education and a specialty in economics.   Having always been engaged in farming and agriculture with her husband, and being a mother of big family, she never managed to work in her specialty. 

Now in her farm, she takes care of four cows, two sheep, two piglets, five beehives and 25 chickens. Her plot of land also gives her a great variety of products such as cucumbers, beans, greens, grapes, persimmons, figs and apples. With the assortment of her farm’s dairy products (milk, cheese and butter) meat and honey that she sells at the city’s wholesale market, she  manages to sustain her big family’s needs. 

This loan in an amount of 450,000 Armenian drams will be great for Narine’s farm, since she wants to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle and also to do some repair work on her vineyard.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle and also to do some repair work on her vineyard

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. She is 59 years old and a mother of two girls and a boy. Tsovianar has a pedagogical education, and for many years has worked at the school as a teacher of Armenian History. Here she is a greatly respected and beloved teacher. Tsovinar’s daughers are already students, but her son is still school aged. Her husband works at the Kapan city’s combine. 

Tsovinar wants to solve her husband’s dental problem since his teeth are in very poor condition. This loan amount will be a great help for him. The doctor already recommended solving his dental problem through installing a dental prosthesis.

loans.use: to solve her husband’s dental problem since his teeth are in very poor condition

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is farmer from Shaqe village, Syuniq region. She lives there with her husband and  two sons (the elder son is in the photo).

Liana has been occupied in the agricultural business since 2004. The farm which she runs includes cows, piglets, and calves, and also cultivation of wheat, emmer wheat, and potatoes.
 
To be able to feed the livestock during the winter, Liana asks for this loan of USD 1,000 to purchase forage. With a good credit history behind her, Liana ensures responsible payments of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Dairiimaa
