She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Tanzila

texts.en: Tanzila is a 33-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 44 years old and married. She is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Abida’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Abida has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Zakriya

texts.en: Zakriya, age 52, is married and in the business, with her husband, of selling animals. She buys baby goats and calves for low prices, raises them, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough money from her business, and from selling milk on the side, to contribute to the family's income. Zakriya needs to improve her business to help cover more of the household expenses. For this reason, she has contacted the Kashf Foundation to request a Murabaha loan for PKR 35,000 to buy one more buffalo to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.name: Mujer Maravilla Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas es muy buena en lo que hace, están luchando por mejores condiciones de vida, de todas y cada una.
La señora Ana es la presidenta del comité, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy noche. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora, que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero se ha ido fortaleciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, frutas, panificados, lácteos, bebidas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, dando a sus clientes lo que piden. Todas están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The sixteen members of this committee take part in diverse activities, and each of them is very good at what she does. They are fighting for better living conditions for each and every one of them.

Ana is the president of the committee. She has a well stocked general store in which she works every day from the very early hours of the morning until late at night. Ana is a very hardworking woman who started with a small business, but it has gone from strength to strength.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables, meat, fruit, baked goods, milk products, drinks and so forth. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales, giving her customers what they request. All of the committee members are very grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, baked goods, milk products, drinks and so forth.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es de la ciudad de Villarrica, el continua estudiando ya que terminó su carrera de la universidad.
Está estudiando la carrera de didáctica universitaria, con lo cual podrá seguir estudiando, de manera a aumentar su conocimiento.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Luis is from the city of Villarrica. He is continuing his studies so that he can finish his university degree. Luis is studying for a degree in University Education. By continuing his studies, he will be able to increase his knowledge.

Luis is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his degree fees. He appreciates the opportunity he has received because he will be able to keep studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Jose  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y mejorando.
La Sra.  Eugenia es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender sus productos varios, que la mayoría son artesanales y reciclados que ella misma los fabrica, con gomaeva y botellas de plásticos. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona y sus compañeras de comité puedan ir mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de plásticos varios, gomaeva, pegamentos, hilos y demás. Todas son mujeres muy sacrificadas que luchan por sus familias y seres queridos.
texts.en:
The San Jose group is in its 1st women's committee program in Concepcion city, which is a zone at a bit of distance from the city center and is growing. It is a zone that is difficult to access, so the members of this group want to fight to help the area grow and improve.

Eugenia is one of the members. She is in a distant zone from the center of the same city where she goes out to sell her various products, the majority of which are artisan crafts and recycled art that she herself makes with foam and plastic bottles. She wants to improve over time and through the provided help everyone in her zone and colleagues in her committee can improve.

She seeks this loan to buy various plastics, foams, glues, thread and other items to make crafts. All the women are very self-sacrificing in that they fight for their families and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy various plastics, foams, glues, thread and other items to make crafts.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen Del Rosario está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, una ciudad alejada de la capital del país, eminentemente rural que luchan por crecer.
La Sra.  Aurora es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender ropas  y comestibles, es una mujer muy sacrificada y quiere seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella está contenta ya que a través de su grupo ha ido mejorando su calidad de vida.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, como así también poder comprar insumos para sus comidas para la venta.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Rosario group is in its 2nd women's committee program in Concepcion city, a city far from the country’s capital, predominately rural and fighting to grow.

Aurora is one of the members. She is in a distant zone from the center of the same city where she goes out to sell clothing and food. She is a very self-sacrificing woman and wants to continue working in order to help her family and loved ones. She is happy that through this group her quality of life has improved.

She seeks this loan to buy various clothing items, as well as be able to buy ingredients for the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca de 46 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida elaborando pupusas en su vivienda, desde hace 5 años por lo que es muy reconocida como una mujer trabajadora y amable. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad. Blanca desea comprar una plancha más grande ya que por el rico sabor de sus pupusas y su amabilidad su clientela ha crecido, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una plancha para pupusas más grande, y así lograr cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca is 46 years old and an enterprising woman who earns her living by making “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) from her home. She has been in business for five years and is well-known for being a hardworking and friendly woman. Blanca resides in her own home along with her life companion and their two children, ages 12 and 18.

Blanca wants to buy a larger cooktop. Her clientele has grown because of her friendliness and the rich flavor of her “pupusas”. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of a cooktop for making large “pupusas”. This will help her meet the demand for the products that her customers are requesting.

loans.use: to buy a large cooktop.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia engages in the dress making business.  She sews and makes dresses of all kinds and  forms. She is a 51-year-old married woman from Mayorga, Leyte. She is a mother of 5 children; her oldest is 21 and the youngest is 10 years old. Virginia has been engaged in dressmaking for 3 years now.

Virginia has requested a loan to buy an additional sewing machine and other supplies like thread and sewing needles. These items will help Virginia fulfill more dress orders to her customers. With these, her income will improve and she can start to pay her obligations and other household expenses.
 
She would like to expand her sources of income in order to become more sustainable in the near future and to continue to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine and other supplies like thread and sewing needles.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She is a 46-year-old married woman with two grown children from Mcarthur, Leyte. She has been engaged for almost 14 years in the hog raising business.

Hermenia is asking for a loan to purchase swine and pig feed. With this funding, she could slowly improve her livelihood. Her swine will produce healthy piglets, and these will help her increase sales in the coming months. Then, Hermenia could invest in other business ventures and set aside for the
renovation of the swine pen.

In the future, she hopes to be productive and more successful in handling her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase swine and pig feed

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en: Viviana is married and she has two children.  She has her own house located in the Omasuyos community.  Although Viviana doesn't have a sewer, she will do anything to get one. Unfortunately, her husband had an accident so he can't move or talk so Viviana is the only one at the house that can earn money. Viviana sells milk and has some cattle. Viviana desperately needs a loan to buy a milking cow and she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Magno

texts.en:
Magno is 46 years old, married, and has four children. His youngest child still attends school.

For 12 years, he has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like noodles, biscuits, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, seasonings, toothpaste, and soap. He is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries to stock his store. These  goods are essentials for operating his store successfully and for providing his customers with a wide variety of products. In this way, he can begin to augment his income and pay his obligations.

Magno wants to expand his current livelihood to be sustainable and to be able to support the schooling of his youngest child.

loans.use: to buy groceries, like canned goods, beverages, toiletries, and soft drinks, for his store.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie, a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte, is a married woman with six children. One of her children is still young.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling items like biscuits, powdered soap, seasonings, canned goods, bread, eggs, and cooking oil. Due to financial problems, Julie is asking for a loan to purchase a variety of goods to resell in her store. These stocks will attract more customers in her local community. 

With this loan, Julie can start to provide proper diets and better living conditions for her family. In the future, Julie dreams of being successful in managing her business to help improve her family's status of living.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods, like noodles, canned food, beverages, and seasonings, for her store.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз 39 лет, не замужем,живет с родителями. Жылдыз в качестве основного дохода с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 3 теленка, 1 лошадь, 5 овец, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом. На участке мерою 4,05 Га Жылдыз  выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zhyldyz is 39 years old, single, and she lives with her parents.  She is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which have been the family's main source of income since 2000.  Thanks to her very hard work, Zhyldyz currently owns two cows, three calves, one horse and five sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som.  In addition to animal husbandry, she also grows beans, for resale, on 4.05 hectares of land.  In order to further expand her business, Zhyldyz has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy two calves for fattening and resale.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.

loans.use: to buy two calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Dona Joy

texts.en: Dona Joy is married and the mother of one child who lives in  Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice, which she sells to earn a living. She started doing this a year ago, when she got married, while her husband works for the military. To improve her output and the productivity of her farm, she has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and organic pesticides. Her goals for the future are to expand her farm and renovate her house so that her family has a safe and comfortable place to live.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and organic pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, tiene una venta de calzado, actividad que desempeña desde hace aproximadamente 12 años, lo heredo de sus padres; su núcleo familiar está formado por su esposa y dos hijos, todos dependen económicamente de don Jesús.
Con el préstamo pagara pedidos de zapatos que están por llegar, solventara su deuda con los proveedores y abastecerá con nueva mercadería su negocio, espera atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos, así tendrá la oportunidad de ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Su visión es aprovechar de buena manera el crédito, atender mejor a su clientela y que su familia tenga un mejor desarrollo en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Jesús sells shoes. He has been doing this for about 12 years. He inherited this business from his parents. His nuclear family is made up of his wife and two children. All depend on him economically.
With this loan, he will pay for the shoe order that is about to arrive. He will cover his debt and stock new merchandise for his business. He hopes to attract new clients, increase his sales, and increase his income. This way he will be able to be punctual in repaying his quotas.
Jesús' vision is to take full advantage of this loan, better attend to his clients, and that his family will have better societal development.

loans.use: to pay off shoe orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, buttons, thread, fasteners, and zippers.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hermano. Ella se se dedica a la venta de cereales y embutidos en el mercado de su localidad. Es muy trabajadora y es muy conocida en su zona como una mujer responsable. Ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño lavable con ducha para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, tubería, taza de cerámica, etc. y de esta forma dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Gloria is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her brother. She sells grains and canned goods in the market in her neighborhood. She is very hard-working and known in the area as a responsible woman. She has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bathroom with a shower so she needs materials such as cement, sand, brick, iron, pipes, ceramic bowl, etc. and in this way can start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, iron, pipes, ceramic bowl, etc. to build a bathroom with a shower.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia is married and she has 4 children. She lives at her own house located in the Vilaque community and she would do anything to have some electricity. Her husband is a mason and he helps her a lot. To make an income, Natalia sells milk to PIL Plant and she has some cattle. Natalia needs a loan to buy a milking cow, and she would greatly appreciate your help.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Veverlie

texts.en:
Veverlie raises and sell hogs to earn a living. She is a married woman with three young children ages 5, 4 and 2 years old respectively. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. She has been engaged in raising hogs for 3 years now. She is asking for a loan to purchase additional pigs. She would like to start to raise more hogs and in the few months, she will be selling healthy pigs. With these additional pigs, her income will improve and Veverlie will be able to prepare healthy diets for her children.

In the future, Veverlie hopes that she can manage her business successfully to improve the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es madre soltera, tiene como meta culminar su carrera con mucho esfuerzo ya que tiene que trabajar y solventar sus gastos familiares y de sus estudios.
Ella estudia para ser docente universitaria, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de la cuota de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a single mother whose goal is to work hard in order to reach her goal of finishing her degree. She already has to work in order to pay for her family’s expenses and her studies.

Mercedes is studying to become a university teacher. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the installment payments for her degree. This will allow her to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Kennedy Arsenio

texts.es: Kennedy de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y sus 2 hermanas. Él se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de huevos actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia desde hace 11 años, además vende tamales de gallina de forma ambulante por los cantones cercanos a su domicilio. Kennedy desea invertir en su negocio ya que al comprar por mayor sus ganancias son mejores por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en cajas de huevos por mayoreo y así obtener mejores ingresos económicos y así tratar de dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Kennedy lives in his own home with his mother and two sisters. He makes a living with his business of selling eggs that has enabled him to support his family for 11 years. He also sells chicken tamales as a street vendor in areas near his home.   

Kennedy wants to invest in his business since buying wholesale is better for his profits. So, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in wholesale egg cartons – to earn a better income and to try to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in wholesale egg cartons.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities like cooking oil, sugar, bread, biscuits, noodles and toiletries. She is a married woman from Dulag, Leyte with a two-year-old child. She has been engaged in operating a sari-sari store for two years now.

Rea is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages. These goods will help attract more customers and slowly generate her income. She could now set aside some savings for emergency use.

Rea would like to expand her sari-sari store business to make it productive and profitable and hopefully she could open a grocery store someday.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 63 years old, married and has eight children.

Jacob likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Jacob plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Jacob’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate ten acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Arnel raises and sells hogs to earn a living. He is a married man with three children ages 18, 17 and 15 years old respectively. To augment his income, he engages in the tuba (coconut) wine vending business. He sells tuba to the locals in his community.

Arnel has requested a loan to purchase additional piglets and pig feed. He will be raising more hogs and in the coming months, Arnel will sells healthy pigs. Thus this could improve his earnings and start to pay his obligations. He could now continue to send his children to school. With these, he could provide his family with nutritious food and better shelter to live with.

In the future, Arnel is determined to expand both his businesses to make them productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional  piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Elizardo

texts.en: Elizardo provides for the family's needs with his income that he derives from farming. He has been growing and harvesting corn for many years, earning well, and he has successfully repaid his previous loans from GDMPC. Aside from this, he also has a piggery raising and selling pigs in town. To improve and boost his pigs, he took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feed. He hopes to see his children become successful in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 32 years. She is married to Tarudd and together they have been blessed with three children who are 14, 10 and 8 years old. She is a tailor as well as a charcoal vendor, businesses she has done for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kshs 30,000. Ruth's tailoring business is doing well.

She has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 20,000, which she will use to add more stock of charcoal. With the anticipated profits, Ruth will be able to add more stock as well as repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be able to support her family and have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Nzuve

texts.en:
Nzuve is 40 years old and widowed with two children. She sells clothes, and has been in this business for three years. It has been profitable, and the income that she makes has enabled her to provide for the needs of her family.

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her children. 

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, fish, meats, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, and other products.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 41 years old, is married and has five children.

Mary likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Mary plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Mary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate nine acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Gerondio

texts.en:
Gerondio is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. He is a 38-year-old married man. He engages in the hog raising business. To have an additional source of income, he also engages in the rice retail business. He sells rice to the people in his community.

He is asking for a loan to pay for pig pen renovation and additional capital for his rice retail business. These are very important tools that will help him continue his hog raising livelihood. He will raise and sell high quality pigs and this could result in gaining a higher income.

Gerondio would like to expand his sources of income to become sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to pay for pig pen renovation and additional capital for his rice retail business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn engages in fishing. She sells fish to earn a living. She is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She has four children aged 15, 11, 8 and 5 years old. She has been engaged in the fishing business for 10 years already.

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing netting, weights and floaters. These tools will create great improvements for her ongoing catch. She could now improve her yield and sell more fish at the market.

Analyn hopes to become more productive and sustainable for the improvement of her livelihood status and to continue financing her children to finish a college education as well.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing netting, weights and floaters.

loans.name: Aidé Maricela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Aidé, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, una vive con ellos. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Aidé con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta realiza varias actividades, ella trabaja en una casa en la cual realiza tareas domesticas pero en las tardes y fines de semana instala un pequeño local en las afueras de su casa en la que vende corviches, empanadas, jugos entre otros alimentos, ella también prepara meriendas, bocadillos  y comidas para fiestas y compromisos sociales, esto último por lo general lo realiza una vez por mes, aunque en este mes por las fiestas tiene muchos contratos por cumplir. Lleva  más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas credit group meets in San Alejo in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, known for its beautiful beaches that lie along its coasts and are frequently visited by national and international tourists.

In this place lives Aidé. She is 39 years old and has a civil union with 2 grown children, one of whom lives with them. Her husband is a businessman. Aidé wanted to earn her own income so she has various jobs. She works in a house as a domestic employee but in the afternoons and weekends she has a small locale outside of her home where she sells snacks such as corviches (a seasoned fish nugget), empanadas (turnovers), juices and other food. She also prepares appetizers, sandwiches, and meals for parties and social events. She generally does this once per month, although this month because of the holidays she has many contracts to fulfil. She has more than 10 years of experience and her businesses are going well.

This loan will be used to buy supplies to prepare her food. She has been a member of the credit group for 9 years because she likes the loans as they are of great help. Her dreams are to provide the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en: Luciano operates a fishing business and has been doing this for many years. He has repaid successfully his previous loan used for fishing. To make his business more successful, he took a new loan recently to purchase additional fishing nets. Hopeful enough to survive a living, he wants to renovate their house for a safe and a better living for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon owns and operates an agriculture business growing corn and other crops to sell. Marlon has been engaged in his business for many years and he earns well from these activities.  He also has a pig raising activity and is still doing well, and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro to buy fertilizer to have a more abundant harvest and additional piglets to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to buy a motorcycle for his transportation purposes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to have a more abundant harvest and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo plants, harvests, and sells rice. He has been engaged in his business for many years and earns well from these activities. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used to purchase farm inputs.  Recently, he took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizers and new seedlings to have a productive farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers and new seedlings to have a productive farm.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a Kiva borrower. He operates a farm where he grows crops. He describes his challenge to be a shortage of water. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will supply water to the community.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
In search of a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, Jackline decided to start farming. According to her, farming will give her everything she has always dreamed of. Jackline is a smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. She owns a quarter-acre farm where she practices mixed farming. On the farm she keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has ten years of experience in farming. 

Jackline is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She will buy good quality seeds of a variety of vegetables and fruits to plant. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. A few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Jackline. Through a group of ten members called Excel Self-Help Group, Jackline has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. 

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholder farmers, both unskilled and semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Jackline because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her horticulture farm

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a thirty-five-year-old hardworking and energetic mother of one lovely child. Monica resides in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions for farming. Monica has farmed for ten years and has gathered experience with farming techniques. She also rears dairy cows, and loves dairy farming - she has even nicknamed one of her cows.

She has been able to take care of her family and provide the basic needs for her child. Monica is a very enterprising woman and has always worked hard on her farm to provide decent meals. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why Monica seeks a loan to start farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Monica feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Monica is disciplined with finances and plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her child and grandchildren to come.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Florence, a 63-year-old mother who is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Kissawai, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and has children that depend on her for their basic needs. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her major primary sources of income are milk and egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet.

She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and, because of high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound, and the demand has been overwhelming. 

To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity, and hence, satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used in improving her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from the poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish, and hence, provide a secure solid education to her children.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
Cayetano, de 42 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y sus hijos se dedican a estudiar en el centro escolar de la localidad.

Cayetano, es profesor desde hace muchos años, su vocación es enseñar sus conocimientos a las diferentes generaciones, él disfruta su trabajo; además de ser profesor, Cayetano, conoce de las labores agrícolas y de ganadería, gracias a sus padres.

Cayetano, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para llegar al lugar donde enseña, ya que está ubicada en una isla.- Cayetano, sacrifica el tiempo que puede compartir con su familia y realizar diferentes actividades, porque se queda toda la semana en la isla, para enseñar sus conocimientos a sus alumnos; posee más de 10 años en esta profesión.

Cayetano, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, ya que desea iniciar el negocio de producción de leche y su esposa le ayudará a cuidarla y a vender la leche en su vecindario.

Cayetano, comprar más animales e iniciar la producción de lácteos, que ha sido uno de sus propósito desde hace mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Cayetano, 42, is married and has 3 children.  His wife devotes herself to the housework, and his children attend the local school.

Cayetano has been a teacher for many years.  His vocation is to teach his knowledge to younger generations, and he enjoys his work.  In addition to teaching, he also knows how to farm and raise livestock, thanks to his parents.  

Cayetano gets up at 4:30am to get to the place where he teaches, because it is located on an island.  Cayetano sacrifices time that he could share with his family and do different activities, because he stays on the island all week to teach his students.  He's been teaching for more than 10 years.

Cayetano needs a loan to buy a cow, because he wants to start a business producing milk.  His wife will help to care for the animal and sell the milk in their neighborhood.

Cayetano has had a goal for a long time to buy more animals and start producing dairy products.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Geoffrey, a 44-year-old, enterprising, humble, and hardworking farmer. He is from Kitale, Kenya, an area known because it’s the “bread basket of Kenya.” Geoffrey is a proud father of five lovely children, whom he really loves and adores and will do anything within his power to comfortably care for. Geoffrey has been practicing farming for the last five years. Through farming he has been able to earn a decent and honest income, and comfortably provide the basic needs for his family. Geoffrey practices mixed farming--that is, crop and dairy farming. Through these two farming activities, he always puts food on the table for his family.

Although Geoffrey has been making profits by selling vegetables and milk to the nearby markets and neighbors, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious man. He has been facing a challenge of transporting his produce to the market and the timely delivery of products. Geoffrey sells perishable products, such as milk and vegetables, and he does not have proper storage facilities. Therefore, he needs to make sure that the products reach the market on time. Because of poor feeder roads and the transport network in his area, this is a challenge he has faced. That is why he is seeking a loan to buy another motorbike. The motorbike will help him in transporting his products to the market.

As a result of this loan, Geoffrey will be able to timely deliver his products. He will earn more profits, because he will be selling his products at a high price because they are still fresh. Geoffrey's dream is to be able to secure the future of his children and to be able to improve his living conditions. Through improved profits, Geoffrey is sure that his dream will be achieved. He will also have a positive impact in his society through creating employment, because he intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike. Geoffrey is patiently waiting for your kindness, so that he can realize his dream.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike to transport his products to the market while they are fresh

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is a first-time borrower at UGAFODE Microfinance and is a cattle keeper. He sells milk and occasionally sells cows to earn income.

Steven's dream is to see his children attaining a good education, and so he works hard to make this dream a reality by providing for all his children and maintaining them in good schools. He is committed to continue doing this by fattening cattle and selling them at a profit.

Steven will use the loan to buy cows that he will graze and later sell to increase his income. He is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is 41 years old. He is married with five children aged between 2 and 17 years; four of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers to grow maize and to sell the maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to grow maize and to sell the maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow her horticultural business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca farms in Mukuuni village which is found in the Central province of Kenya. She has enjoyed farming since she was a little girl. She officially started doing farming as a business six years ago when she got married. Rebecca's husband owns a 3-acre piece of land which she utilizes to generate extra income to help him provide for the family.

Rebecca keeps one cow, 2 goats and 8 heads of poultry on the farm for milk, eggs and meat. She also runs a small retail shop and a motorcycle transportation business as well.

To make her work easier on the farm, Rebecca is seeking a 50,000 KES loan to purchase a water pump and hose pipes. With these tools, the task of making trips to the river to fetch water will be a thing of the past. She will be simply pumping water from the river straight to the farm. The water will be for both domestic purposes and farming.

This loan will save Rebecca a lot of time and energy that she might as well spend on her 3-year-old baby.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and hose pipes

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Lidia isn't married but she has a couple of children. Lidia has her own house located in the Omasuyo community in El Alto. The house has light and water services but the house doesn't have sewage. Her partner works as a taxi driver and has his own vehicle. Lidia sells milk to PIL Andina Plant and has some cattle. Lidia needs a loan to buy forage for her cattle, and she would appreciate Kiva's help a lot.

loans.use: to buy forage for her cattle.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon es de la ciudad de Villarrica, es una persona que se esfuerza por poder ser un profesional exitoso, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo ha usado en pagar sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto, lo que le ha sido muy útil.
El pide este préstamo para cubrir la totalidad de sus gastos de titulación de manera a poder terminar de pagar esa deuda que tiene. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Ramon is from the city of Villarrica. He is a person who strives to become a successful professional. Ramon says that his previous loan was used to pay his degree expenses. Being able to cover these expenses proved to be very useful.

Ramon is requesting this loan so that he can cover his degree expenses in full in order to finish paying off this outstanding debt. He appreciates this new opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to finish paying his degree expenses.

loans.name: María Elisa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  de 12 y 4 años que estudian en colegio y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es chofer. 
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella   tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, frutas y legumbres, carnes, pescado, entre otras cosas, allí sus clientes consiguen de todo y es por eso es que su clientela se mantiene y aumenta cada día más,  trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, lleva más de 3 años con su tienda la cual a pesar del poco tiempo que tiene la tiene muy bien surtida y le da ganancias que les sirven para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Lleva 5 años en el  Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son aumentar su tienda.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas credit group meets in San Alejo in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, known for its beautiful beaches that lie along its coasts and are frequently visited by national and international tourists.

In this place lives María. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children ages 12 and 4 who attend school and kindergarten, respectively. Her husband is a driver.

María is a woman who like to make herself useful, so she has a store of basic goods in her home where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, fruits, vegetables, meat, fish, and other items. There her customers can find everything and for this reason her customers support her and grow every day. She works every day from 6 AM until 8 PM, at times even later. She has had this store for more than 3 years and despite of the short time in existence she has it well-stocked and the profits serve to help her family get ahead.

This loan will be used to stock her store more, by buying rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other products. She has been in the credit group for 5 years and she likes the help that the loans provide. Her dreams are to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other products.

loans.name: El 21 Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario El 21 lo integran tres socios trabajadores que día a día luchan por el bienestar de sus familias, para ofrecerle los recursos básicos. Quien lo coordina es Zacarías un hombre exitoso en sus labores diarios, acompañado y que a sus 40 años, ofrece productos derivados del maíz como es pinol blanco, pinol, pinolillo, chicha y tortilla en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace dos años, ya que trabaja como cuerpo de vigilancia en una casa particular y de los ingresos obtenidos impulsó su negocio, es el tercer ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamiento para su negocio, lo que le ha permitido aumentar la producción de su negocio mejorando sus ingresos y así cubrir con las necesidades básicas de su familia, esto lo ha motivado a seguir solicitando el financiamiento en ADIM y esta vez invertirá en quintal de maíz, flete de leña, cacao, canela, etc., una de sus metas es seguir creciendo en el ámbito de su negocio. Otros integrantes son, Ingrid una mujer que a sus 25 años de edad comercializa ropa de segunda en las calles de su comunidad, además realiza costura en su domicilio desde hace dos años, y Heydi una joven de 22 años que se dedica a la comercialización de ropa de segunda de manera ambulante en las calles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "El 21" consists of three hardworking members who daily fight for the well-being of their families in order to offer them basic resources. Zacarías is the coordinator. He is a successful man in his daily work. He is married, 40 years old, and sells products derived from corn including white corn, baby corn, corn beverage, and tortillas in his home. He started this business two years ago. He works as a security guard in a private home and uses the income to support his business. This is his third loan cycle with ADIM to provide financing to his business, which has enabled him to increase production resulting in increased income and being able to cover his family's basic necessities. This has motivated him to continue seeking financing with ADIM and this time he will buy a quintal of corn, cocoa, cinnamon, a load of wood, etc. with the goal of increasing production in his business. One of his goals is to continue growing his business.

Other members are Ingrid, a 25 year old woman who sells used clothing on the streets in her community, in addition she has been sewing from her home for two years; and Heidi, a 22 year old woman who sells used clothing as a street vendor on the streets in her community.

loans.use: to buy a quintal of corn, cocoa, cinnamon, a load of wood, etc. with the goal of increasing production in his business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 48 years old and runs a sari-sari store. She sells basic household merchandise like biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, powdered milk, soap, candies and other commodities. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has four dependents, two of which are still attending school.

Milagros has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional goods for the store like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, toiletries and beverages. She could then offer a variety of goods to her customers which would likely lead to higher sales. With these, she could continue to finance the schooling of her children and provide better shelter.
 
In the future, she hopes that she will be more productive and profitable in managing her business to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for the store like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 75 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 14 hijos mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña María es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para salir adelante ya que esta sola y ella no quiere  incomodar a su hijos por sus gastos, ella se dedica a la venta de gas de uso doméstico, tiene un deposito en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de este producto tan necesario en los hogares del país, ella aprovecha que uno de sus hijos  trabaja en una distribuidora de gas y le deja en su depósito  lo que ella necesita, lleva más de 30 años en este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va  a emplear en comprar gas de uso doméstico. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y continuar con sus actividades.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas community bank meets in the San Alejo zone of the very beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita. The area is known for the beautiful beaches along all its coasts. These beaches are frequented by national and international tourists.
Maria lives there. She is 75. Several years ago, her husband passed away; she is a widow. She has 14 children, all grown and independent.
Maria is a woman who has had to work hard to get ahead, because she is alone and she doesn't want to bother her children with her costs. She sells gas for home use. She has a small store in her home. Her clients come when they need this product, which is very necessary for the country's homes. She takes advantage of the fact that one of her children works at a gas distributor and gives her what she needs. She has had this business for over 30 years, and it has allowed her to get ahead.
She will use this loan to buy gas for home use. She has been part of her communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because the loans have always helped her get ahead. Her dreams are to have good health and to continue with her activities.

loans.use: to buy gas for home use.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando con su apoyo. Ella se gana la vida elaborando chocolate artesanal por encargo, el cual distribuye en los comedores cercanos desde hace 5 años, por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Milagro desea invertir en su negocio ya que cada vez son más las personas que gustan de sus productos, además desea vender por mayoreo en las tiendas cercanas ya que ha observado que la demanda es buena, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cacao, azúcar y canela para elaborar por mayoreo el delicioso chocolate que tanto gusta a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milagro is 38 years old and resides in her own home along with her 17-year-old son who is studying with her support. She earns her living by making artisanal chocolates to order. Milagro has been distributing her products to nearby eateries for the past five years. She has a significant number of customers who prefer to buy her product each day.

Milagro wants to invest in her business since there are more people who enjoy her products. In addition, she wants to sell in bulk to stores nearby since she has noticed that demand is high. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in cacao, sugar, and cinnamon for making her delicious chocolates in bulk according to the tastes of her customers.

loans.use: to buy cacao, sugar, and cinnamon for making her delicious chocolates in bulk.

loans.name: Gladys Narcisa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y el menor de 13 años que estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante y chofer.
Doña Gladys es una mujer que le gusta a base de su trabajo ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella los fines de semana instala en su casa un pequeño local en el cual vende encebollados  acompañados de jugos naturales que ella prepara o gaseosas a gusto de sus clientes que en estos dos días disfrutan de sus deliciosos platos, allí trabaja con la ayuda de su familia, esta actividad la lleva realizando desde hace 13 años y sus ganancias le permiten solventar ciertos gastos necesarios en el hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado,  yuca, sodas y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora su negocio.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito De Mujeres Unidas communal bank meets in San Alejo in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabita. The area is known for its beautiful beaches along all the coast. The beaches are frequented by national and international tourists.
Gladys lives there. She is 49, married, and has two children: one grown and one 13 years old, who studies in school and still lives with her. Her husband is a businessman and a driver.
Gladys is a woman who likes her business because she helps her husband with the household costs. On the weekends she runs a small shop out of her home where she sells food with natural juices which she prepares, or pop based on her customers' likes. They enjoy her delicious dishes. She works with her family's help. She has been doing this for 13 years and her earnings allow her to cover certain costs for her household.
This loan is to purchase fish, yucca, sodas, and groceries for making her food. She has been in the community bank for 4 cycles and she likes it because she is able to improve her business with the loans.
Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy fish, yucca, sodas, and groceries.

loans.name: La Prueba Group

texts.es: La Prueba es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro mujeres laboriosos y esforzados en sus labores diarias, quien lo coordina es Zonia es una mujer casada y que a sus 69 años de edad, cuenta con una experiencia de veinte años en la comercialización de verduras y granos básicos de manera ambulante, es el vigésimo ciclo que ADIM le brida el financiamiento para su negocio, lo que le ha permitido mantener su negocio ya que es el que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de tomate, chayote, cebolla, plátano verde, plátano maduro, yuca, etc., estos son los productos que mayor demanda tiene a diario. Las otras integrantes son, Simona una mujer de 45 años de edad comercializa raspados y leña de manera ambulante en las calles de la municipalidad y así brindar el alimento diario a su familia, Reyna una joven de 22 años de edad, quien en busca de su superación y de su familia comercializa hamacas en uno de los mercados de la capital y en el mercado de Rivas, y Ruth una señora de 41 años de edad, comercializa frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados de la capital desde hace quince años, de esta manera trata de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Prueba" is comprised of 4 hardworking women who exert themselves in their daily work.  Zonia is the coordinator of the group.  She is a married, 69 year-old woman who has 20 years of experience selling vegetables and staple grains on the street.  This is her 20th loan cycle with ADIM, which has provided financing for her business.  This has enabled her to keep the business running, which provides the income she needs to cover the family's expenses.  

With this new loan, she will buy tomatoes, chayote, onions, green bananas, plantains, cassava, etc.  These are the products that are most in demand each day.  

The other members of this group are: Simona, 45, who supports her family by selling shaved ice and firewood on the streets of the municipality; Reyna, 22, who is looking to succeed and help her family with her business selling hammocks in one of the markets in the capital and in the Rivas market; and Ruth, 41, who has been selling fruits and vegetables in one of the markets in the capital for 15 years.  With these businesses, they are trying to improve their families' living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl is single and lives with her parents in Zamboanga del Sur. She helps her parents in operating their own farm for a living. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to cover the costs for farm fertilization and weeding maintenance. She is willing to help her parents and the entire family, for she wants everyone in the family to improve. In the future, she wants to buy a farmland for her own better source of income.

loans.use: to cover the costs for farm fertilization and weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en: Edmund is single, and owns and operates an agriculture business growing coconuts to sell. Edmund has been engaged in farming for many years and he earns well from these activities.  His farm is still doing well, and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. He built a house for the family for a safe and better living. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro to purchase additional construction materials for his house construction. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to buy vehicle for their transportation as part of improvement of his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Romnick

texts.en: Romnick owns and operates an agriculture business planting and harvesting a variety of crops to sell. Romnick has been engaged in farming since she was young and earns well from these activities. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used to purchase spare parts and tires for his motorcycle. His farm is still doing well, and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan to buy fertilizer in order to have a more productive farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 50 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 5 and 29 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 25 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. He will then sell his maize harvest at a local market. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his maize crops
